programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Newly married couple Ed and Clare are planning to start a family soon and will need a larger home. Ed wants to raise his family where he grew up in Lunigiana, Italy, so Jonnie Irwin finds some rural properties within their £250,000 budget. However, Clare wants to remain close to her relatives, so asks Laura Hamilton to find them suitable properties in the Sevenoaks area of Kent.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: The property experts help new grandparents Geoff and Barbara Harrison choose a second home to enjoy with their growing family in Devon or in Languedoc, France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kent couple Chris and Sue, who are struggling to decide whether to downsize locally in Royal Tunbridge Wells, or make a completely new start in life by moving to the south of France. With this in mind, she demonstrates what their budget could buy them on the Cote d'Azur.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Debra Mann from Reading, Berkshire, has fallen in love with the Bay of the Somme in the north of France, and has set heart on a holiday getaway where she and her sister can spend time with family and friends. Scarlette Douglas shows them both a selection of properties for a £64,000 budget - with plenty of surprises along the way.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Matt and Vicky Wade ask Casas Manuel to find them a holiday home with plenty of outside space for sunbathing, while Sharon shows her sister's friend three apartments in Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple who live in Australia are given help looking for a property as they look to spend half of the year in Spain, while a woman is aiming to find a holiday home in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A woman searches for a new home in Alicante, Spain, with a budget of 120,000 euros, while Daniel and Margaret from Glasgow look for a property near to the coast in Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay continues his travels across America saving failing restaurants from disaster. In the first of two visits to Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, the chef encounters Joe Nagy, who claims he has the best menu from New York to Los Angeles. However, his servers and diners tell a different story, and his resistance to change leads to some explosive confrontations.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Italian family restaurant Sabatiello's in Stamford, Connecticut, where the owner's fiery temper upsets the staff and has left him more than $1million in debt. Gordon's help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of Anthony Trobiano, whose restaurant in Great Neck, New York, is failing even though his partner's parents have given him their life savings and he has taken out half a million dollars in loans. Gordon has some harsh criticism about the unhygienic kitchen and the quality of the food being served, but the owner has trouble accepting his advice.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jack's Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chef's advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a restaurant in Mount Sinai, New York, which appears to be stuck in the 1980s. The crumbling decor and unenthusiastic head chef at the Handlebar need to be tackled, but owners Bill and Carolyn LeRoy are in denial about the problems they face.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The popular armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring Line of Duty, University Challenge, Rio Ferdinand: Being Mum and Dad, Comic Relief, Broadchurch, One Night with my Ex, All Round to Mrs Brown's and the News.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz with guest captain Claudia Winkleman and Johnny Vegas going up against Jon Richardson and Reginald D Hunter. Sara Pascoe joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Self-confessed nerd Lachlan strikes gold when he sits down to eat with psychologist Rachel - who turns out to be an avid Star Wars fan. Nanny and part-time weightlifter Lucy hopes to pick up a new partner in the restaurant - and it seems as though charity administrator Caroline may be the one for her - while Alistair, who at 5ft 7 worries about his height, meets magazine editor Emily. Will he be talking tall after their date?.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: Abel Morrison has three wives and 11 children, and his newest wife, Marina, is heavily pregnant, so it's a chaotic time for the family. However, while his first wife Suzie takes the challenges of plural marriage in her stride, his second wife Beth is struggling with Marina's demands on their husband's attention - and things come to a head on the day of the birth.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Expensive Food
programme.desc: London is home to more billionaires than any other city on the planet and they use a private network of luxury food suppliers. This two-part documentary follows the companies who cater to them, with the opening episode examining how businesses must adapt and fight harder than ever before to win a foothold in this lucrative new market.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Long-distance lorry driver Neil, 52, has fallen backwards off a ramp onto a concrete floor and is sent for an urgent CT scan, the results of which are a shock. Also receiving treatments are 29-year-old Ben, who has dislocated his shoulder in a cycling accident, and Wendy, 73, who is in resus with a severe open ankle fracture after falling at home.(n)

programme.title: Super Slimmers: Did They Really Keep the Weight Off
programme.desc: Documentary featuring six extraordinary weight-loss champions, who shed 80 stone between them, to find out what happened to them next. After they collected their prizes and the press photographers left, did they manage to keep the weight off? Plus, a ground-breaking science study on a TV star who lost 17 stone reveals the body's incredible but little-known biological response to dieting that sabotages efforts to keep weight off.(n)

programme.title: Catastrophe
programme.desc: Rob returns to his job at Braeband stating he is just back from holiday in Canada, while bad news pulls Sharon back to Ireland. With Sharon away, and left home alone to look after the children, Rob's life continues to spiral out of control. Unhappy with the situation at his family home Chris decides, in typical style, to confront his nemesis. Comedy about an Irish woman and an American man's relationship, written by and starring Sharon Horgan and Rob Delaney.(n)

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade heads to the Canary Islands for a packed mini-break with actress and writer Lena Dunham, the star and creator of American comedy drama Girls. In the north of the island, Richard and Lena visit a guachinche pop-up restaurant, where they have goat stew before exploring the barren lunar-like landscape around the volcanic Mount Teide and spend the evening stargazing. There is also a sculpture tour, including works by Henry Moore and Joan Miro, as well as layered coffee, a spot of golf and a search for whales.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps workaholics David and Karen who cannot decide whether to buy a place to escape to in Dorset or the alpine city of Graz in Austria. Jasmine reveals what their £130,000 budget will get them in both locations.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple who are torn between two vibrant cities. While Cliff would like to move to Brighton, Sue dreams of living in Montpellier, southern France, where she would like to open a B&B.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple who are about to retire and are unsure whether to relocate to Carcassonne, France, or simply move further south from their current Berkshire home to a property near Chichester, West Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Clinton Dall from West Sussex, a self-made businessman and father of four aiming to build one of the largest homes ever featured on the show. Dall wants the end project to be perfect - from the finish of his mirrored cruciform steel columns, to how the floor tiles line up with the dining room table, and is willing to spend whatever it takes to achieve his vision. However, the construction represents a huge risk, as down one road lies abject failure and financial ruin, while down the other, is the creation of something sublime and almost heroic.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The documentary looks at how disputes and fights between neighbours are on the increase. Crewe officers Billy Elliot and Greg Greaves help a man who claims someone else has moved into his flat while he was on holiday, while in Warrington, PC Jon Tetlow investigates reports of a man frightening children. A background check reveals numerous reports of problems between the man and his neighbours, so police have to act quickly before locals take matters into their own hands.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary series giving an insight into the world of debt collection from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments. Brian and Graham have been warned to expect trouble as they evict some tenants from a south London flat, one of whom has a reputation for violence. Everything goes smoothly until the enforcement agents make a shocking discovery in a child's bedroom. Paul and Steve head to Slough to collect wages owed to a freelance worker, but the debtor is less than happy to find the high-court enforcement officers on his doorstep and things get physical.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Sheriff Paul Bohill tackles the case of a small debt owed by ex-footballer Neil `Razor' Ruddock to a kennel owner, before being forced to evict a school dinner lady in south London. Meanwhile, in the north of England enforcement agent Stewart MacCracken heads out with trainee Iain Taylor to confront a Yorkshire builder they need to get payment from at his home, while a reptile shop owner hit by online competitors urgently needs to pay a debt for the feed company he relies on to keep his animals alive.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement agents Paul Bohill and Steve Pinner are in Birmingham on a potentially dangerous, full-scale eviction of a large traveller community. Meanwhile, in London's diamond district Brian O'Shaughnessy and Delroy Anglin are chasing nearly £6,000 owed by a jeweller to an unhappy customer, although a solicitor tries to convince Delroy his client owes nothing.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary giving an insight into cash-strapped Britain from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments, including High Court enforcement bailiffs and repossession teams. The series follows each case as it unfolds, recording the thoughts and feelings on both sides, the process of repossession and the impact it has on all involved.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The ongoing documentary series profiling some of Britain's welfare recipients continues, this time highlighting people who are keen to find love, all while struggling to make ends meet. In Norwich, 56-year-old Donna built an alter-ego as a means to escape a life of hand-outs, and is now tentatively trying her hand at online dating. Doncaster resident and sci-fi fan Carl, 39, tries to save some of the £140-a-month he receives in benefits to attend a comic convention, where he hopes to discover a mutual attraction with a like-minded girl. Meanwhile, in Bury St Edmunds, 25-year-old single mother Jade worries her OCD-driven cleaning routine is getting in the way of her quest to find the perfect - and gainfully employed - man.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: Documentary series about people living on benefits, including 60-year-old Avril, who is one of the long-term unemployed. Her nickname is the Bargain Queen because she spends so much time at car-boot sales - although her biggest bargain so far is a free holiday, courtesy of her mother. Steve has just returned to the UK from Turkey and at 56 is facing unemployment for the first time in his life, and transgender Jess finds jobseeking difficult while she undergoes her transitional medical treatment.(n)

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Families from opposite ends of the wealth and class divide swap homes, budgets and social status for seven days to discover how the other half lives. This week, the Caddy family of Bristol trade places with the Williams family from Weston-super-Mare. The Caddys rank in the top 10 per cent of Britain's wealthy, and live in a seven-bedroom home, while for the eight-strong Williams family, who are among the nation's poorest 10 per cent, the swap means leaving their rented three-bedroom house and enjoying a weekly budget of £1,700 instead of their usual £110.(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell the Doctor
programme.desc: The doctors come to the aid of a law graduate with extreme acne, a landscape gardener whose hands keep seizing up for no apparent reason and a woman with an unsightly varicose vein.(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Wesley Gibson, un hombre apocado, descubre que su padre, a quien nunca conoció y que fue recientemente asesinado, pertenecía a una sociedad secreta de asesinos. Después de que una atractiva mujer vestida de cuero lo recluta y lo hace miembro de la socieda(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: Bruce Lee uses a martial arts tournament as the pretext to infiltrate the island fortress of a one-armed drug baron. Forget the story, watch the moves(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek horror tale in which a small Nevada desert town is terrorised by giant man-eating worms. Two handymen are forced to postpone their plans to escape their humdrum lives after several mysterious deaths and a series of earthquakes turn out to be the work of predatory subterranean creatures which lay siege to the terrified townsfolk(n)

programme.title: A Beautiful Mind
programme.desc: Russell Crowe stars as maths genius John Nash, who finds that paranoia and schizophrenia are problems he may never solve. Acclaimed drama. Mature themes/flashing images. (2001)(136 mins)(n)

programme.title: Silk
programme.desc: A 19th-century Frenchman's devotion to his wife is tested during his perilous trade missions to Japan in search of rare silkworm eggs. Keira Knightley and Michael Pitt star in this sensual and visually stunning adaptation of Alessandro Baricco's bestseller. Alfred Molina, Koji Yakusho, Mark Rendall. Directed by Francois Girard(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two aging friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on vacation together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: The Birdcage
programme.desc: Flamboyant Hollywood remake of the 1979 French farce La Cage Aux Folles. When his son's conservative future in-laws come to town, gay club owner Armand and his cross-dressing partner Albert are forced to play husband and wife(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Touching, tragic romantic drama with Keanu Reeves and Charlize Theron who fall in love with only a short amount of time to spend together(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: James Cox directs the sleazy Hollywood murder tale Wonderland, starring Val Kilmer as legendary porn star John Holmes. Using a non-linear plot structure, the film explores different perspectives of the quadruple homicide that occurred on July 1, 1981, in the Hollywood Hills. At the lowest point of his career and the height of his drug addiction, Holmes was implicated in the murders of the Wonderland gang: Ron Launius (Josh Lucas), Billy Deverell (Tim Blake Nelson), Barbara Richardson (Natasha Gregson Wagner), and Joy Miller (Janeane Garofalo). Launius' wife, Susan (Christina Applegate), was the only survivor. Led by Detective Sam Nico (Ted Levine), the police investigation reveals a dark criminal underworld surrounding Holmes, his disapproving wife, Sharon (Lisa Kudrow), and his innocent teenage girlfriend, Dawn Schiller (Kate Bosworth). Eric Bogosian stars as notorious Hollywood nightclub owner Eddie Nash. Wonderland premiered at the 2003 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: A Swedish man opts for a sex change and undergoes the world's first gender reassignment surgery, but his marriage suffers as his artist wife struggles with the transition(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: A naive Texan aims to become a New York City gigolo, a forms a mutually-beneficial friendship with a hustler who takes him under his wing. When the hustler's health starts to fail, the Texan turns one final trick in a selfless bid to take his new friend to Miami(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: As they await eviction from a Miami hotel, four retired mobsters try to scare off the other residents by making them an offer they can't refuse. Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss. Donatelli: Dan Hedaya. Donato: Seymour Cassel. Det. Neal: Carrie-Anne Moss. Ferris: Jennifer Tilly. Directed by Michael Dinner(n)

programme.title: Presumed Innocent
programme.desc: Presumed Innocent, a murder mystery, based on a novel by Scott Turow, and well directed by Alan J. Pakula, tells the story of prosecutor Rusty Sabich (Harrison Ford) who is accused of murdering his mistress Caroline (Greta Scacchi) and must prove his innocence. Sabich, a successful prosecutor, whose marriage is shaken by his wife Barbara's (Bonnie Bedelia) discovery of his affair, finds himself in a nightmare when his former mistress is found dead and all the physical evidence points to him; even his wife seems to believe that he is guilty. Ford is excellent in his role as Sabich, convincing both as an attorney and as a man who wants to take his formerly happy life back. Bonnie Bedelia is wonderful as Sabich's unforgiving wife, and gives a compelling, enigmatic performance in a difficult role. Presumed Innocent both a plausible, believable courtroom drama and an exciting murder mystery is highly recommended(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: A superb ensemble cast---including Matthew McConaughey, John Turturro, Alan Arkin and Amy Irving---is featured in this penetrating drama about several unfulfilled New Yorkers whose lives intersect. The perceptive, intricately plotted script explores the different ways people search for happiness. David Connelly, Clea DuVall(n)

programme.title: Scream
programme.desc: Spoof of '80s slasher films about a killer who targets a teenager whose mother was brutally murdered the year before(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz(n)

programme.title: Suicide Kings
programme.desc: In this hip crime drama, a spoiled rich teen's (Henry Thomas) sister is abducted, and he and his punk friends decide to kidnap an ex-mob boss (Christopher Walken) as a negotiating tool. But the wily mobster turns the tables on his bungling captors. Denis Leary, Sean Patrick Flanery, Jay Mohr, Jeremy Sisto, Laura San Giacomo(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A dangerous sniper traps a self-centered NYC publicist in a public phone booth(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Produced by Tom Hanks, written by Aaron Sorkin, and directed by Mike Nichols, this adaptation of George Crile III's incendiary bestseller tells the remarkable story of the Texas congressman whose efforts to prevent the Red Army from overtaking Afghanistan eventually led to the collapse of the Soviet Union while simultaneously fueling the rise of radical Islam. In the early 1980s, a hastily assembled army of Afghan "freedom fighters" achieved the remarkable feat of fending off Soviet invaders despite the fact that the odds were overwhelmingly stacked against them. At the time, Texas congressman Charlie Wilson (Hanks) was a key member of the hugely powerful House Appropriations Committee. Illuminated to the specifics of this remarkable war by a high-profile Houston socialite, Wilson spearheaded an effort to provide hundreds of millions of dollars in weapons and training to the Mujahideen with more than a little help from brilliant but prickly CIA operative Gust Avrokotos(n)

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: Three giants of the cinema, Marlon Brando, Robert De Niro and Edward Norton star in Frank Oz's caper thriller. Brando is the crime boss who pressurises ageing thief De Niro into one last big job with 'inside man' Norton as his accomplice but as the cocky Norton starts compromising the job, De Niro becomes more worried about the chance of success(n)

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: Director Ridley Scott spins this yarn concerning a Harlem drug kingpin (Denzel Washington) who smuggles heroin into the country by hiding it in the bodies of U.S. soldiers killed during battle in Vietnam. As honest NYPD detective Ritchie Roberts (Russell Crowe) investigates the case, his integrity is compromised by the meddling of the crooked Detective Trupo (Josh Brolin)(n)

programme.title: Trade
programme.desc: Adriana is a 13-year-old girl from Mexico City whose kidnapping by sex traffickers sets in motion a desperate mission by her 17-year-old brother, Jorge, to save her(n)

The second in the series of murder mysteries, starring Dick and Barry Van Dyke alongside Kimberly Quinn and Jonathan Banks.(n)

Meanwhile, Mac and Peyton investigate the discovery of a mummified corpse in a condemned building. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

He resorts to killing his sibling and rigging the death scene to look like a scuba-diving accident. However, the crumpled cop sees through the ruse and in the process reveals he is something of a wine buff himself. Detective drama, with Peter Falk, Donald Pleasence and Julie Harris.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A supposedly dead marine suddenly regains consciousness on the autopsy table, leaving the team struggling to solve the mystery of how he came to be in such a strange predicament. Investigations reveal he had recently been on a trip to Baghdad - and uncover an unexpected link to Gibbs' past. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is tipped off about terrorist activity, and two agents are murdered during the ensuing investigation. Believing the information to be a set-up, the team tries to solve the case with assistance from a guilt-stricken Paula Cassidy, who holds herself responsible for the tragedy. Drama, starring Jessica Steen.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee feels the pressure as the team investigates a double murder that appears to be inspired by his still unpublished new novel. His sense of guilt is compounded by the realisation that one of his colleagues could become the killer's third target. American drama following the work of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service, starring Sean Murray and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Jenny Shepard tries to solve the murder of an underworld source who was prepared to give information on the activities of arms dealer La Grenouille. Unfortunately her behaviour becomes increasingly obsessive as the case proceeds, leaving Gibbs wondering if her judgement is being clouded by a personal motivation. Starring Lauren Holly and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A blind man unwittingly photographs evidence of a murder, leading Jethro and the team to the corpse of a petty officer who was stabbed with a knife left at the scene. programme.title: Bring It On

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: Lindsay Lohan stars as Cady Heron who, having been home-schooled by her parents, is new to high school and totally unversed on how to survive the jungle-like teen society. But, befriended by two other outsiders, goth Janis and gay Damian, she infiltrates queen bee Regina George's hive to bring about her downfall. Mark (Freaky Friday) Waters' teen comedy is a cut above the rest, thanks to a smart screenplay from Saturday Night Live regular Tina Fey (based on Rosalind Wiseman's non-fiction survival guide for young girls, Queen Bees and Wannabees ) and outstanding performances not just from Lohan, but the whole cast (watch out for Tim Meadows as the scene-stealing Principal Duvall)(n)

programme.title: You Again
programme.desc: A high-powered PR professional discovers that her brother is about to marry the woman who made her high school life a living hell in this comedy starring Kristen Bell and Odette Yustman. Back in her teens, Marni (Bell) was a little awkward. These days she's a successful career woman, but the memories of being tormented by popular cheerleader Joanna (Yustman) still make her break into a cold sweat. Flying home for her brother's Will's wedding, Marni realizes to her horror that she will soon be sister-in-law to the pompon-wielding mean girl who once humiliated her in front of the entire student body. And apparently her nemesis learned from the best, because back when Marni's mom (Jamie Lee Curtis) was in high school, Joanna's aunt (Sigourney Weaver) served up the same kind of treatment. Now that they're about to become family, Marni and her mom do their best to let bygones be bygones. But old grudges die hard, and by the time the wedding bells chime, these old foes will already have some saucy stories to share with their grandchildren(n)

programme.desc: This weekly, syndicated children's reality show was packaged by Steve Rotfeld Productions, the same firm responsible for such similar FCC-friendly efforts as Awesome Adventures and Wild About Animals. Hosted by Christine Long, the series used actual footage and re-enactments to show its target audience (kids aged 13 to 16) how to confront and cope with extraordinary situations, many of them dangerous in nature. Typical episodes demonstrated CPR techniques, the extinguishing of household fires, and the handling of moral dilemmas. Also offered were tips on building, cooking and general housekeeping, with added input from experts in these fields. Offering three to four "features" per half hour episode, WHADDAYDO? was first distributed by TVI Media beginning the week of September 12, 2005(n)

programme.title: The Quick and the Dead
programme.desc: This western borrows many conventions from the films of Sergio Leone as it follows the exploits of a female gunslinger involved in a bloody quick-draw contest. Sharon Stone is the female version of "the man with no name." She rides back into her hometown of Redemption looking only for vengeance against Herod (Gene Hackman) the reigning gunslinger. Redemption is under the control of Herod, who uses his strong arm to keep the locals in line and takes 50 cents of every dollar. Every year there is a quick-draw competition in Redemption and while some come to make a name for themselves, or collect the money, Ellen is here to take out Herod. The rest is a series of standoffs, as contenders quickly fall away, revealing who the quickest really is. The colorful cast of characters includes: Kid (Leonardo DiCaprio) who is Herod's son and desperately trying to get out of his shadow, Cort (Russell Crowe), a killer turned preacher who Herod forces into the competition, and many others. Raimi was hand-picked by Stone to direct this spaghetti western and if anything is notable about this film, it's Raimi's contribution. The performances are all well done, despite the fact that Hackman can do this role in his sleep and Stone is trying way too hard to be tough; but this thin plot only carries so far, and it's Raimi's unique visuals that keep things interesting, even when they get ridiculous. More a remake of a Sergio Leone-style western than a darker update of the genre -- what most westerns made in the 90's tried to be -- this western has fun with itself and never really takes itself too seriously(n)

programme.desc: An informer goes on the run when his witness protection programme collapses and leaves him a prime target for the drug barons he once betrayed. He drags his former girlfriend into the chase, and together they set off on a cross-country adventure(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Grand Visions is a short season of films driven by the vision and boldness of strong directors; passion projects made on a grand and uncompromising scale. The season kicks off with director Baz Luhrmann's western/ war adventure/ romance hybrid that's set in the Australian outback and stars Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman. It is 1939 and Lady Sarah Ashley has travelled halfway round the world to persuade her husband to sell his cattle station and return back home to Blighty. It's soon obvious that she hasn't anticipated the primitive realities of life in northern Australia, nor has her upbringing prepared her for an encounter with the likes of the rough and ready drover who is instructed to chaperone her from Darwin to the ranch. But the pair are fated to become much more closely acquainted than either could have imagined. The plot also encompasses the lot of the region's Aboriginal people, via the plight of local lad Nullah, and the first Japanese attacks on the northern territories. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: A mysterious wanderer looks for dry land after Earth is engulfed by water(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster in this uproarious comedy(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic science fiction thriller, about a detective who works for a police department that uses three infallible psychics to help convict murderers before they have actually committed their crimes. When the detective discovers that he has been identified as a future killer, he becomes a fugitive from his own colleagues. Based on a short story by Philip K Dick. Starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow, Steve Harris, Neal McDonough(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Wesley Gibson, un hombre apocado, descubre que su padre, a quien nunca conoció y que fue recientemente asesinado, pertenecía a una sociedad secreta de asesinos. Después de que una atractiva mujer vestida de cuero lo recluta y lo hace miembro de la socieda(n)

programme.title: Sudden Impact
programme.desc: The fourth film in Clint Eastwood's popular Dirty Harry series. Detective Harry Callahan is sent to a seaside town to investigate his latest case, only to discover a new and unlikely suspect(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Arnie's at his best as tough L.A. detective John Kimble who must find a drug lord's wife so she can testify in court. Problem is, she's gone into hiding to protect her son. With only the name of the kid's elementary school, Kimble must go undercover... As a kindergarten teacher! Academy Award winner Linda Hunt joins the cast with Academy Award nominee Cathy Moriarty in this great blend of action, thrills, and humor(n)

programme.title: The Children

programme.title: Raising Arizona

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: In this high-octane thriller, the infamous San Andreas Fault gives way, producing a devastating earthquake across California. A highly skilled helicopter pilot (Dwayne Johnson) races to save his ex-wife (Carla Gugino) in Los Angeles before the complete destruction of the city. After one daring rescue, the pilot flies north toward San Francisco in search of his estranged daughter (Alexandra Daddario), racing against time and the inevitable aftershocks that promise to devastate the coastline(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen

Lieberman and Nick Thornborrow, this Focus World production directed by Peter Billingsley stars Vince Vaughn as an unscrupulous criminal who learns that he's been targeted by the entire underworld, prompting him to take out a million-dollar insurance policy to benefit his estranged daughter (Hailee Steinfeld). With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.title: Australian Racing
programme.desc: Coverage of a meeting Down Under.(n)

programme.title: Australian Racing

programme.desc: Preview of race meetings across the country - including the latest betting news from today's cards.(n)

programme.desc: Preview of race meetings across the country - including the latest betting news from today's cards.(n)

programme.desc: A look back at yesterday's action.(n)

programme.desc: Reaction to the latest results.(n)

programme.title: Racing Review
programme.desc: A look back at yesterday's action.(n)

programme.title: Racing News
programme.desc: Preview of race meetings across the country - including the latest betting news from today's cards.(n)

programme.title: Raceday Live
programme.desc: Coverage of today's meetings at Doncaster, Cork and Fairyhouse.(n)

programme.title: Stateside
programme.desc: Live coverage from the United States.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: John Torode is joined by chefs Ben Tish and Tommy Banks and wine expert Peter Richards. Featuring classic clips from Rick Stein, Nigella Lawson, the Hairy Bikers and the Spice Men.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: The food writer shares ideas to make everyday family meals special with no-fuss dishes and also tries her hand at milking a goat before showing her granddaughter how to make her own goat's cheese for a family picnic.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests look forward to the weekend's fixtures, which include Liverpool v Everton and Arsenal v Manchester City. Plus, interviews with Saido Berahino and Ben Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott heads to Ardingly in Sussex where two sets of Bargain Hunt teams go head-to-head to grab the best finds. Expert Anita Manning leads a team of brothers and a pair of musicians for the reds, and Mark Stacey's blues are a married couple celebrating their wedding anniversary and a couple of animal lovers.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a buyer find a home in Snowdonia close to her family and able to accommodate a business, as well as learning about shepherding in the protected landscape.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: A gang of streetwise penguins decides to escape from New York's Central Park Zoo and return to a life in the wild, but when Marty the zebra and his friends follow suit, they end up stranded in Africa on a jungle island without a clue about how to fend for themselves. Animated comedy, with the voices of Ben Stiller, David Schwimmer, Chris Rock, Jada Pinkett Smith and Sacha Baron Cohen.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a medical version of the celebrity quiz, with contestants Guy Henry, Rosie Marcel, Vicki Pepperdine, Ricky Grover, Raji Singh, Hilary Jones, Charles Dale and Amanda Henderson trying to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Game show in which Nick Knowles challenges two pairs of complete strangers to team up, with each pair battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for £50,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Alicia wakes up in Sam's bed, while Iain and Gem's relationship is tested when they spend the day together on the rig and Iain is confronted with his biggest fear. Evie is confronted at home by a masked intruder who attacks her and ransacks the property, and when Evie manages to escape, she is hit outside by Susie's car.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Agnes and the family are joined by Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield, who are put through their paces in the Brown family version of The Cube, while Lulu pops in for a chat. Dermot and Buster recruit EastEnders' icon Adam Woodyatt and get him to spout wildly inaccurate facts to the tour group along the way to help with their new business venture, and Ricky Wilson gets intimate with Agnes in Foley's pub before the Kaiser Chiefs play out with their latest hit Hole in My Soul.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Everton at Anfield and Burnley v Tottenham Hotspur at Turf Moor. The Reds were looking to continue their outstanding recent record against their local rivals, while Spurs were the latest club to try to put a blemish on Burnley's superb home record this season.(n)

programme.title: Jagged Edge
programme.desc: Defence attorney Teddy Barnes is haunted by an incident when her actions led to a case of wrongful imprisonment. Desperate not to make the same mistake again, she battles to clear publishing magnate Jack Forrester of murdering his wife. In the end she falls in love with him, but begins to wonder whether he really is innocent. Thriller, starring Glenn Close, Jeff Bridges, Peter Coyote, Robert Loggia and Lance Henriksen.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Everton at Anfield and Burnley v Tottenham Hotspur at Turf Moor. The Reds were looking to continue their outstanding recent record against their local rivals, while Spurs were the latest club to try to put a blemish on Burnley's superb home record this season.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: Round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs, and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents moral and religious discussions on topical issues from Patcham High School in Brighton.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Thomas Plant hosts as two soldiers go up against a pair of brothers, with the teams joined by experts Nick Hall and Natasha Raskin to scour the Norfolk Antiques Fair to buy three items they hope will make a profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore properties in Croydon, Oldham and Wolstanton in Staffordshire, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven and the team report on the arrival of the tiny beetle that can make or break a crop, before embarking on a coastal forage. Plus, rookie smallholder Paul Martin gives tips on how to keep bees.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton travels to Leicestershire to help find a home for a couple who want to give their young family a more rural lifestyle. While searching the county for properties within their £380,000 budget, the host learns how the residents of Melton Mowbray are trying to protect their food-producing legacy.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Josie D'Arby visits the fishing port of Peterhead to meet the local trawlermen. Plus, a look back at a musical revolution that occurred in the Church 50 years ago.(n)

programme.title: The Boat Race
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents live coverage of the men's and women's University Boat Races on the River Thames, as Cambridge aim to retain the men's title, and Oxford the women's. This is the third time that both races will be taking place on the same afternoon and on the same course, and thousands of people will line the course of four miles and 374 yards from Putney to Mortlake in what is one of the longest-established events on the British sporting calendar.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Reports on the UK's forests. Matt Baker helps out with an inventory of the New Forest's trees, and Ellie Harrison visits Inverness to take a look at industrial timber production and the impact of forestry on red squirrels. Sean Fletcher reports on the Scottish tradition of hutting, John Craven examines the revival of working with horses in forests, and Charlotte Smith discovers whether enough trees are being planted in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Caversham Park, near Reading, home to the BBC's international news monitoring service. Items brought in to be valued include some notes written by a 17th-century Shakespeare fan, a ring connected to a moving story of the California Gold Rush, and watercolour illustrations depicting life in 18th-century India.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: A new DCI is placed in charge of Operation Trapdoor as Roz fails to report for duty. A dismembered body is discovered, and the AC-12 team delves deeper into the case as evidence mounts up that an innocent man has been convicted of crimes he did not commit. Kate makes progress in her undercover role as all the signs point to crucial evidence being covered up by Roz, but the investigation suffers a setback when the team discovers that the main informant, forensics investigator Tim Ifield, has gone missing.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Arsenal v Manchester City at the Emirates Stadium and Swansea City v Middlesbrough at the Liberty Stadium. The clash between the Swans and Boro was crucial in the battle to avoid the drop, while the Gunners and City had their eyes on boosting their chances of finishing in the top four.(n)

programme.title: I'm Different: Let Me Drive
programme.desc: New series. Stories of learner drivers with physical and learning disabilities and the unusual challenges they face in passing their test. The pupils in the first episode are a single mother who suffered a brain injury as a child that has affected her ability to tell left from right and a man with a rare chromosome disorder that causes him severe joint pain.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter J, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: Beautiful But Dangerous
programme.desc: An heiress returns to her home town to shower gifts on the people who donated money in order for her to undergo a life-saving operation when she was a child. However, the woman is not prepared for the consequences of her good deed. Comedy drama, starring Jean Simmons, Robert Mitchum, Arthur Hunnicutt and Edgar Buchanan.(n)

programme.title: We Dive at Dawn
programme.desc: A British submarine crew is unexpectedly ordered to carry out a top-secret mission to sink the German fleet's latest battleship in the Baltic Sea. But it is not long before disaster strikes and the vessel becomes stranded in the middle of the ocean with no fuel or food. Second World War adventure, starring John Mills, Eric Portman, Reginald Purdell and Niall MacGinnis.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates Brad Bestelink's documentary, which was filmed over the course of 18 months and follows a female leopard and its two cubs living in the wilds of Botswana alongside less-than-friendly lions, wild dogs and hyenas. The competition for food is tough, and the cats have to learn the new skill of fishing if they are to have any chance of survival.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore an end-of-terrace house in south Wales, a semi-detached three-bedroomed property in Southampton, and an ex-council flat in east London.(n)

programme.title: Raymond Blanc: How to Cook Well
programme.desc: The chef gives six masterclasses in basic cooking techniques, using each one to demonstrate five dishes, with recipes ranging from simple to ambitious. He begins with the slow-cooking method, preparing an Asian-flavoured beef shin with papaya salad, a squid and chorizo stew, and a compressed apple terrine.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the food provided by British waterways as they fly-fish for trout, prepare a meal of stuffed wild duck and discover how the Gloucestershire tradition of eating baby eels has virtually disappeared.(n)

programme.title: Gypsy
programme.desc: Musical about striptease artist Gypsy Rose Lee and her relationship with her ambitious mother, who was determined to make stars of both her daughters. The only place Rose can find work is in a burlesque house, where the established strippers help her make it to the top. Starring Rosalind Russell and Natalie Wood. Stephen Sondheim's songs include Everything's Coming Up Roses, Let Me Entertain You and Small World.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Bill Bailey narrates this natural history documentary telling the story of some of nature's most extraordinary partnerships, revealing what sometimes happens when animals need an itch scratching, help getting into food or home security assistance. The answer is, to find a partner - and not necessarily one of the same species. Highlights include hippos joining forces with fish for a full-body exfoliation and ravens inviting wolverines over for some bone-crunching assistance with their dinner.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The first semi-final takes place as two teams of four students compete to make it to the final of the competition, which was won last year by Peterhouse, Cambridge. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the second semi-final, in which two teams of contenders use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Pudding and Cheese, Maria and Peter, Widow and Murder, and Ops and Funk.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Experts Kate Bateman and David Barby search for antiques that can be sold for a profit in Colchester, Essex, where finds include boxes of old toy cars and an art deco item. Presenter Paul Martin tracks down the last remaining practitioner of an ancient craft that once lifted people out of poverty.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don begins a brand new project when he starts a new soft fruit garden, and also plants new potatoes and divides herbaceous plants in the jewel garden. Frances Tophill visits an extraordinary tropical garden in Barbados developed from a collapsed cave, while the programme also catches up with exponent of gardening for wildlife Chris Baines, in his own small town garden. Plus, as part of the series' 50th anniversary, Mark Lane nominates the plant he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half century. Including weather.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti join the staff working in some of the most extraordinary hotels around the world, beginning with Marina Bay Sands in Singapore, which employs 9,500 people and caters for a million guests a year. Their duties include acting as attendants at the world's largest infinity pool, working as a butler under a former special forces officer, and joining a catering team that provides Brazilian, Chinese, French and Japanese cuisine for 60 restaurants.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton embarks on his most difficult journey to date as every destination has been long abandoned by people, meaning there are no ferries, piers or proper landing stages. He visits the once-inhabited island of Heisgeir, sails around the gannet haven of Sula Sgeir and endures rough seas to make landfall on the extraordinarily remote island of North Rona. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.sub-title: The Bullet Is Not for Firing.
programme.desc: The men of Walmington-on-Sea's Home Guard use up all their ammunition shooting at a passing aircraft, leaving Captain Mainwaring no alternative but to hold a court of inquiry to find out what really happened. Comedy first aired in 1969, starring John Le Mesurier, Arthur Lowe and Clive Dunn.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: An extended edition of the comedy quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers host Stephen Fry finds most interesting. In this edition, he invites David Mitchell, Sue Perkins and Sami Shah to join regular panellist Alan Davies as he meanders about some places that start with the letter M.(n)

programme.title: Jimi: All Is By My Side
programme.desc: Premiere. Biopic of Jimi Hendrix following the events of 1966, when he left New York to spend a year living in London. The relationships he developed over that time would shape his career as a musician, culminating in his famous appearance at the Monterey Pop Festival. Starring Andre Benjamin, Hayley Atwell and Imogen Poots.(n)

programme.title: Populaire
programme.desc: A woman desperate to escape her small-town roots applies for a job as a secretary at an advertising agency. Her ability to type quickly catches the eye of an executive, who trains her to take part in a speed-typing contest. Comedy set in the 1950s, starring Deborah Francois, Romain Duris and Berenice Bejo. In French, English and German.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.desc: Members of the volunteer fire brigade, led by farmer and church organist Kevin Adams, take part in a weekend of training down at the harbour. There is also a lot of charity fundraising going on, from Zoe Adams' famous jumble sales to a calendar featuring Sark's emergency services personnel as they've never been seen before.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: New series. The green-fingered team returns with a fresh season of advice for gardening amateurs. Jim McColl looks at the progress of the over-wintered vegetables, George Anderson challenges himself to produce a weekly salad in his small garden, and Chris Beardshaw demonstrates how to plant and train a hedge on stilts. Carole Baxter looks at the tiny world of snowdrops and also sets about early spring pruning jobs for both ornamental and productive plants.(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don journeys to the Mediterranean, the cradle of European civilisation, for the next stage in his horticultural tour. In Italy, he witnesses the elaborate stone and water gardens created during the high Renaissance. He also investigates the influence of Moorish culture on European gardens, visiting the Aguedal in Marrakesh, and Spain's magnificent Alhambra.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don begins a brand new project when he starts a new soft fruit garden, and also plants new potatoes and divides herbaceous plants in the jewel garden. Frances Tophill visits an extraordinary tropical garden in Barbados developed from a collapsed cave, while the programme also catches up with exponent of gardening for wildlife Chris Baines, in his own small town garden. Plus, as part of the series' 50th anniversary, Mark Lane nominates the plant he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half century. Including weather.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: This week's show comes from Denbighshire, where Matt baker meets one of the country's most successful sheep farmers while Ellie Harrison observes the spring mating rituals of grouse and goes in search of adders on the moorland. Sean Fletcher meets an artist who makes edible flowers, Adam Henson visits a college in Cumbria that provides a sheepdog training course, and Tom Heap examines the future of British farming.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Eating Together
programme.desc: Nigel visits three home cooks to learn about well-loved soup recipes that have come from around the world. Miles tells him how his mother brought her recipe for spicy fish tea with her when she moved to Wiltshire from Jamaica in the 1960s, while Sumiko gives him a lesson in the art of Japanese miso soup. Finally, Nigel meets 87-year-old Regina at her home in Leeds to find out how she makes a classic Jewish chicken soup, joining her family for a Friday night Shabbat dinner.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson rustles up more of her favourite recipes, this time with the emphasis on cosy and comforting mood. For breakfast she makes a tray of dairy-free chai muffins, while there's a low-key lunch of Asian-flavoured short ribs - a perfect make-ahead, tender beef stew. Inspired by her visits to America's west coast, an informal supper for friends features Nigella's home-made, oven-baked fish tacos, which involve a bit of DIY at the table, followed by a salted chocolate tart for pudding.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with a line-up of guests, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Figure Skating
programme.desc: Highlights of the event from Helsinki, Finland, where Javier Hernandez and Evgenia Medvedeva were among the favourites. Presented by Robin Cousins and Katherine Downes.(n)

programme.title: When Danny Won the Masters
programme.desc: The story of Danny Willett's surprise 2016 Masters victory at Augusta, which saw him become the first British golfer to win the Major event since 1996.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing's Len Goodman takes weather presenter Carol Kirkwood back to St Helier, Jersey, to reminisce about a holiday in 1973.(n)

programme.title: The House That £100K Built
programme.desc: Kieran Long and Piers Taylor follow the fortunes of Jody and Lori, who are desperate for a modern family home and have decided to gamble everything they have on building a new one from scratch. Kieran takes the couple to see a series of homes tailor-made for the people that live in them. Each is packed with ideas they could try. As the build gathers pace, Lori struggles to make colour choices, so Piers explains the basics of colour theory, but will they really move from safe whites and greys to bold oranges and blues? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Kate Bateman and David Barby head for Essex to attend a valuing day at Colchester Town Hall, where they find a pair of valuable paintings of fish and two Clarice Cliff items. Meanwhile, Paul Martin visits a nearby stately home being restored to its former glory by a group of local campaigners.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Cherry Healey return with the programme shedding light on how some of Britain's biggest factories make the nation's favourite products, beginning with popular breakfast cereals. Gregg starts by receiving a boat-load of corn fresh from Argentina, and witnesses as it is cooked, milled and flavoured to become a top-selling cereal brand. Cherry learns about the immunity-boosting powers of vitamin D, which is added to many of the UK's most popular cereals, and historian Ruth Gordon samples a Victorian breakfast of lobster and pig's head, as part of a daily meal that included 4,500 calories.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the final heat, with reigning champion Apollo taking on rival contenders Ms Nightshade, Coyote, Rusty, Crackers'n'Smash, Meggamouse, Trolley Rage and Carbide through two group battles and a mini-league. The battles are all overseen by judges Professor Noel Sharkey, Professor Sethu Vijayakumar and Dr Lucy Rogers.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Sabine Schmitz compete in a buggy race across the Californian desert that is one of the toughest events in motorsport, and Matt LeBlanc test drives new supercar the Ford GT.(n)

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the second half of the journey, Simon travels along the Black Sea Coast to the capital of Ankara and the Northern Highlands, witnessing first hand the aftermath of fighting in Kurdish areas and meeting a conservationist attempting to preserve the region's brown bears. He then returns to Istanbul, where he takes part in a popular TV series set in the palace of the Ottoman Sultans.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian and author Joe Lycett plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by fellow funny men Ivo Graham and Phil Wang.(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: A charismatic English teacher at a New England prep school in the 1950s raises eyebrows among his strait-laced colleagues by encouraging the students to live life beyond their expectations. Unfortunately, the boys find their families and the rest of the teaching staff are not so understanding about their desire to follow their dreams. Peter Weir's drama, starring Robin Williams, Robert Sean Leonard, Ethan Hawke, Josh Charles and Gale Hansen.(n)

programme.title: The Silk Road
programme.desc: Sam Willis traces the history of one of the world's most famous trade routes, which ran from China's ancient capital Xian through the cities of central Asia and Persia. He begins his travels in Venice, examining how the architecture was shaped by Eastern influences, before arriving in China's ancient capital Xian where he discovers how a single deal to trade silk for war horses created a global network.(n)

programme.title: Woolly Mammoth: Secrets from the Ice
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the natural history of the Ice Age mammals that once roamed across what is now Europe and Asia. Detailed information about their lives has been gleaned from carcasses preserved in the Siberian permafrost, and the anatomist meets scientists using genetic, chemical and molecular tests to reveal the adaptations that allowed mammoths to evolve from tropical animals to creatures capable of surviving extreme cold.(n)

programme.title: Follow the Money
programme.desc: Nicky breaks into Kristina's home to recover the evidence against Christensen. Absalon is on the verge of bankruptcy, and Claudia will stop at nothing to get revenge. In Danish.(n)

programme.title: Follow the Money
programme.desc: Alf and Mads race to stop Christensen before he destroys the Danish economy. Claudia betrays Steen, and Amanda tries to prove Simon's innocence. In Danish. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Richard Skinner and Tommy Vance present music from June 30, featuring Shalamar, Nick Heyward, Irene Cara, Paul Young, Tom Robinson, Bucks Fizz and Rod Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen introduce performances from 7 July by Roman Holliday, Mary Jane Girls, Freeez, the Cure, Funk Masters, and Jimmy the Hoover.(n)

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.sub-title: Classic Albums: The Beach Boys - Pet Sounds.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the making of the Beach Boys' classic 1966 album, to mark the 50th anniversary of its release. Featuring contributions from songwriter Brian Wilson and the other surviving members of the group Mike Love, Al Jardine, Bruce Johnston and David Marks, as well as rare archive footage from the recording sessions.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of the Guitar Riff
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the impact of the guitar riff on popular music over the past 60 years, including a look at how it became the foundation on which rock 'n' roll was built. With stories from Brian May, Dave Davies, Hank Marvin, Joan Jett, Nile Rodgers, Tony Iommi, Robert Fripp, Johnny Marr and more. Narrated by Lauren Laverne.(n)

programme.title: The Kinks at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by the band from shows including Top of the Pops and The Old Grey Whistle Test, charting how their sound developed from the 1960s to the 1980s. The programme also features highlights from lead singer Ray Davies' solo career, including clips from Later with Jools Holland and his 2007 concert at the BBC Electric Proms.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Eighties
programme.desc: Showcasing a selection of musical performances from the BBC archives, featuring the Teardrop Explodes, Orange Juice, Robert Wyatt, Aztec Camera, Billy Bragg, the Fall, Robyn Hitchcock and the Egyptians, the Pogues and the Style Council.(n)

programme.title: Dame Vera Lynn: Happy 100th Birthday
programme.desc: Katie Derham makes use of archive footage and family records to tell the story of how Vera Lynn came to become one of the UK's most well-known musical stars. Vera celebrates her 100th birthday on March 20th, and marks the occasion by reminiscing about her early days in showbusiness, with help from her daughter Virginia. She recalls starting out as Vera Welch in the 1920s, first appearing on stage at the tender age of seven, before charming the nation's servicemen and becoming the `forces sweetheart' during the Second World War. She also remembers becoming the first British artist to achieve a number one in America in the 1950s, and a similar feat in 2009, when she became the oldest living singer to reach the same position in the UK charts. Along the way, Second World War veterans and entertainment industry figures - including Paul McCartney, Barry Humphries and Miriam Margolyes - pay tribute to the power of her voice.(n)

programme.title: Giselle: Belle of the Ballet
programme.desc: Dancer and artistic director Tamara Rojo explores the ballet about a peasant girl who is seduced and betrayed by an aristocrat, which has been a defining role for many acclaimed ballerinas. She examines the ballet's origins in 1840s Paris and spiritual themes, and goes behind the scenes on two very different contemporary productions - a traditional restaging and a modern reinvention.(n)

programme.title: Do We Really Need the Moon
programme.desc: Space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock explores Earth's relationship with its satellite, explaining why it is responsible for the ebb and flow of the tides, dictates the length of a day and provides a rhythm for the seasons. She also details how, despite once being closer to the planet, the moon is now perfectly placed to help sustain life, and uses computer-generated imagery to reveal what would happen if it were removed from the equation.(n)

programme.title: Gravity and Me: The Force That Shapes Our Lives
programme.desc: Jim Al-Khalili investigates the amazing science of gravity, recreating groundbreaking experiments, including the moment when Galileo first worked out how to measure it. He investigates gravitational waves, finds out from astronauts what it's like to live without gravity, sets out to find where in Britain gravity is weakest and so where we weigh the least, and helps design a smartphone app that volunteers use to demonstrate how gravity affects time and makes us age at slightly different rates.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts investigates how science came to understand sex - a simple word for a very complex set of desires, including individual passions, wants and emotions. In this documentary, she trawls through 45 years of Horizon archive to examine how the world of science has strived to solve people's sexual problems, and searched for ways of improving performance.(n)

programme.title: MotoGP Rewind

programme.desc: Tony travels to North Africa on the trail of missing agent Ziva, who is thought to have been tracking down a terrorist leader called Saleem Ulman. programme.desc: Sheldon receives a nasty surprise when he visits his mother in Houston, while Raj's murder mystery party causes conflict for the rest of the gang members. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Neil hosts the second dinner party in and around Belfast in a bid to win the £1000 prize, presenting good old fashioned, country style cuisine to his guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Keen golfer and window cleaning business owner Paul hosts the third dinner party in Belfast, hoping to impress his guests with take on fine dining.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Livewire DJ and events organiser Ryan is the next to host in and around Belfast - and having arranged parties for thousands, he will confident he can satisfy four fellow diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cailin is pinning her hopes of winning on a Eurovision extravaganza on the final night of competition in Belfast, creating a series of tried and tested dishes from across Europe.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Wiltshire couple Martin and Michelle MacClay want a holiday home in France's Loire Valley, so Scarlette Douglas helps find them the perfect property on a budget of £73,000.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the countryside surrounding Edinburgh helping Ian find a new home - but it soon becomes clear that he is more interested in finding the right shed for his collection of cars and tools than somewhere to lay his head. Phil Spencer is with Rogan and Jane, who suffer from chronic indecision when it comes to house hunting - and that's the least thing they need as they have to find a home fast before their first baby arrives in three months' time.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Clinton Dall from West Sussex, a self-made businessman and father of four aiming to build one of the largest homes ever featured on the show. Dall wants the end project to be perfect - from the finish of his mirrored cruciform steel columns, to how the floor tiles line up with the dining room table, and is willing to spend whatever it takes to achieve his vision. However, the construction represents a huge risk, as down one road lies abject failure and financial ruin, while down the other, is the creation of something sublime and almost heroic.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: A party of explorers studying the sunken remains of the famous liner meets an elderly woman who was a passenger on the ill-fated maiden voyage. She recounts how she boarded the ship while on the brink of being forced into marriage by her family, and was stopped from killing herself by a penniless artist. She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. James Cameron's Oscar-winning romantic drama, starring Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates and Bill Paxton.(n)

programme.title: Colombiana
programme.desc: A 10-year-old Colombian girl witnesses the murder of her parents at the hands of gangsters, but is rescued by her uncle, who takes her to the US and raises her to be a cold-blooded killer. Years later, she is still working for him as an assassin, but is secretly planning to avenge her parents' deaths. Action thriller, starring Zoe Saldana, Cliff Curtis, Michael Vartan and Lennie James.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the concluding part of his trip to the Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, Gordon's disagreement with proprietor Joe Nagy erupts into one of his most intense confrontations yet. Just when it looks like he has turned the corner and is ready to accept help, Joe slips back into his old ways, denying his own failings and picking petty fights. Can Gordon get this stubborn owner to finally accept his advice and secure the future of his restaurant?.(n)

programme.title: Our Guy in China
programme.desc: Guy Martin concludes his Chinese adventure by taking on his toughest-ever physical challenge as he sets to break the record for the fastest crossing of the Taklamakan Desert on a bicycle. He must travel 341 miles along the world's longest desert highway in less than 47 hours and as extreme fatigue sets in, he starts to nod off while riding, swerving off the edge of the road. Stopping in a lay-by for food and rest, he can't sleep because of his overactive mind and decides to keep riding through the night as he heads for the finish line in Qiemo.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert visits Reigate in Surrey, where retired couple Lenny and Mary are struggling to secure a sale on their home. programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond

programme.desc: Debra helps to plan a recruitment party at Frank's lodge, leading Ray to grumble about how much time she is spending away from home. Comedy, starring Patricia Hearten and Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The owner of the local comic-book shop suffers a heart attack, so Bart and Milhouse take his place behind the counter while he recuperates - and prove to have a real knack for commerce.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family constructs a tennis court in the back garden and Bart becomes an expert player, much to the annoyance of a jealous Homer. Featuring the guest voices of Venus and Serena Williams, Andre Agassi and Pete Sampras.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Things look bleak for Krusty the Clown when his TV show is binned and he is dropped by his talent agency. But then he is reunited with the veteran agent (Joan Rivers) who got him started in showbusiness all those years ago, and together they plan his big comeback.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Following on from a pilot edition shown last Christmas, the Gogglesprogs return for a six-part run in which they maintain a close eye on a range of TV output, from entertainment shows and documentaries to some all-time classic films and up-to-the-minute news stories. Participants include six-year-old Molly and her eight-year-old brother William who both love helping out on the family farm, Stephanie who adores Justin Bieber and her friend Christina who prefers classical music, and schoolmates Jacob and Connor. In this opening programme, the youngsters offer their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on The Undateables, Donald Trump and Mamma Mia!.(n)

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: A directionless loser tries to prove himself to the woman he loves by volunteering for a travel writing assignment. He is sent to the Bermuda Triangle, where he ends up stranded on an island populated by miniature people to whom he is a giant. Fantasy comedy, starring Jack Black, Emily Blunt, Jason Segel and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Night at the Museum
programme.desc: A new nightwatchman at New York's Museum of Natural History discovers his job entails more than he bargained for. Once night falls, an ancient Egyptian spell brings the museum exhibits to life, entangling him in a riotous struggle to restore peace and order before the sun rises and visitors arrive. Fantasy comedy, starring Ben Stiller, Dick Van Dyke, Robin Williams, Carla Gugino and Ricky Gervais.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Titanic: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Investigative journalist and Titanic expert Senan Molony examines recently recovered photographs of the doomed ship, which provide fresh insight into the reasons for its sinking. The images reveal a strange mark on the hull, which may prove previously overlooked stories of a fire raging in the boiler room. This blaze may explain why the captain chose to ignore warnings of icebergs ahead and why the vessel sank so quickly after the fatal collision.(n)

programme.title: Spying on the Royals
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary examining an espionage operation conducted to gather information on Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson. Shown to mark the 80th anniversary of the king's abdication, the programmes examines recently declassified documents revealing the extent of the surveillance and who ordered it, as well as featuring dramatic reconstructions and eyewitness accounts.(n)

programme.title: Homeland

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines

programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Disappearing Rainbow.

programme.desc: Holly, Ben and the Wise Old Elf play a trick on Nanny Plum.(n)

programme.desc: George and Peppa help Granny and Grandpa Pig clean out their attic.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
