programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The team faces Stockman-Fly's new insect minions, and Raph has to man up to overcome his fear of insects and lead the team.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors: Takedown with Vinnie Jones
programme.desc: Vinnie Jones introduces clips of exciting police chases, as elite pursuit units crack down on law-breakers on the highways and byways of Britain.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A foul-mouthed pensioner pushes Barry's patience to the limit, Sarah gives a bad-boy biker an early birthday present and Jim's Audi S3 is outclassed by a car 30 years its senior. Plus, Mike is left open-mouthed when he encounters a drink-driver who is three times over the limit.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on four single parents struggling to provide for their children while living on state welfare. Lauren dreams of a career in the Army, where she would get help with childcare, and 40-year-old Joanne is struggling to heat the home she shares with her eight-year-old daughter. Craig has only recently taken sole responsibility for his daughter after the end of his relationship, while clairvoyant and mother-of-six Sue is planing a council house swap - but competition is fierce.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: The documentary about living on benefits meets people struggling to survive island life. They include Tina, who is struggling to cope on the Isle of Sheppey in Kent - despite turning her life around and kicking her heroin habit, she is now finding life on the island tough thanks to her mobility problems. Single parent Matt lives in Cowes on the Isle of Wight, where the lack of jobs makes life a constant struggle, while Chrissy on Canvey Island in Essex is refusing to pay her rent as she believes her home is not up to scratch. As a result, however, she is facing eviction.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: Women who claim benefits while looking after several children. They include Chesterfield mum Maria, who has five kids to five different dads and has not worked since 2002. She is so desperate to get off benefits she has signed herself up to the same college course as her daughter. Birmingham woman Karen has six children and a seventh on the way with partner Ashleigh - and although his job search is not going well he keeps himself busy in other ways. In Weymouth, Kate picks up almost £30,000 a year in benefits to supplement her husband Ian's income as a taxi driver - and spends more than £170 a month of this on pocket money for her seven kids.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A woman owes five months' rent, but refuses to leave unless the bailiffs arrive, while a man wanted to sell his house post-breakup, but the tenants are still there five years later. Plus, a man happily living in his garden shed.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A landlord seeks urgent advice from eviction specialist Chris after finding his three-bedroom terrace has been stripped bare of the fittings, the flooring, and even the grass on the lawn. A landlady gets a shock when she finally gains access to her property, a couple living in America are owed £10,000 in rent from a house in the UK, and Dave from Peterborough Council's housing team comes across some of the worst damp and mould he has ever seen.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul and Ben face a challenging eviction in London, where a vulnerable tenant in rent arrears has barricaded her front door, and the agents receive a tirade of abuse. Meanwhile, Brian and Del chase a debt of nearly £2,000 in Surrey, before trying to recover almost £3,000 in Northamptonshire. Finally, Steve and Ru head to Portsmouth to evict a young family for a landlord who wants her property back.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The officers chase a debt of almost £2,000 in unpaid parking fines, and later encounter the extraordinary case of a debt of £80,000 owed by a hotel owner to his ex-girlfriend. However, as they begin to search the property, they call upon police back-up as the agents fear the debtor may have access to firearms. Elsewhere, two officers head to a car garage in Manchester where the owner owes £2,000 after losing a court case over a faulty vehicle.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when two pharmaceutical executives are murdered, uncovering a criminal who changes his identity for each offence he commits, and has evaded capture across several countries. To make matters worse, the agents are made to feel the pressure by the watchful eye of Granger. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and Miguel Ferrer.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A deep-sea diver is murdered on the job, and his co-workers all become suspects. However, when they return to the surface, they must remain in a high-tech decompression chamber for four days. With each of their suspects confined within a tank, the NCIS team must complete an unorthodox investigation from the outside. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: The Championship
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce highlights from the weekend's games in the Championship, including Barnsley v Sheffield Wednesday at Oakwell and Newcastle United v Wigan Athletic at St James' Park. Plus, the best of the action from Reading v Leeds United at the Madejski Stadium and Huddersfield Town v Burton Albion at the John Smith's Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: Goal Rush
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce all the goals from the latest games in Leagues One and Two, including Bolton Wanderers v Chesterfield and Grimsby Town v Doncaster Rovers.(n)

programme.title: FIA Formula E Live
programme.desc: The Mexico City ePrix. Coverage of the fourth round of the campaign from the Autodromo Hermanos Rodriguez in Mexico. This track has held numerous races from Formula 1 to the World Endurance Championship during its illustrious history and many different configurations. A new 2.1km layout was created for the arrival of Formula E in 2016, and at more than 2500m, the track is the highest in Formula E - and one of the highest in the world.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Blood Creek
programme.desc: A Nazi scientist travels to America in the 1930s to perform an occult experiment. In the present day, a man is reunited with his missing brother, who claims to have escaped from kidnappers. They head for the farm where he was held, planning revenge, but stumble on the terrifying result of the Nazi ritual. Horror, with Henry Cavill, Dominic Purcell and Michael Fassbender.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton head for Milton Keynes, where they help a couple desperate to sell their home so they can move to France. Ann sets out to persuade them to tone down the riot of colours and do away with the mountains of clutter that make the house seem small and dark.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Angels of Jarm
programme.desc: Ephraim is accused of taking things from the playgroup.(n)

programme.title: Roary the Racing Car
programme.desc: Roary feels put out because all the cars are paying Conrod too much attention.(n)

programme.desc: Peppa and George's toy basket is full, so Mummy Pig decides it is time to order a new toy cupboard.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.desc: The gang organises a birthday party for Edward, but nothing goes according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Marshall makes friends with a gosling that he names Fuzzy, but the bird will not leave when it is time for his flock to fly south.(n)

programme.desc: When Crusher and Pickle challenge Blaze and his friends to a sailboat race, Crusher tries to cheat and accidentally runs both ships aground on a tropical island. Blaze and his crew must find the missing pieces of their ship to enable them to sail back home.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: A mole causes problems at King Thistle's golf course, so a gnome is hired to drive it away.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: Rockwell warns the Turtles that Don Vizioso plans to wipe out all the mutants in New York - but he is too late to save Raph and Donnie from being captured by the gangster.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: The Championship
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce highlights from the weekend's games in the Championship, including Barnsley v Sheffield Wednesday at Oakwell and Newcastle United v Wigan Athletic at St James' Park. Plus, the best of the action from Reading v Leeds United at the Madejski Stadium and Huddersfield Town v Burton Albion at the John Smith's Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: Goal Rush
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce all the goals from the latest games in Leagues One and Two, including Bolton Wanderers v Chesterfield and Grimsby Town v Doncaster Rovers.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Craig Charles puts some state-of-the-art headphones to the test. These wireless units incorporate a voice-controlled smart assistant and a fitness tracker, all for £99. Jon Bentley dials up Chinese smartphone the Huawei Honor 6X to see if it is actually better than its more established rivals - and at a fraction of current prices. Plus, Georgie Barrat gets exclusive access to the New York Toy Fair, to check out latest tech playthings that will hit the shops in a few months' time.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jim is on the trail of a speeding motorcyclist, Jon reveals his guilty pleasure when he retrieves a stolen caravan and dog handler Barry is brought to book by a would-be lawyer. Meanwhile, Sarah deals with the aftermath of a drunken brawl between two brothers.(n)

programme.title: Operation: Daybreak
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama about the assassination of leading Nazi Reinhard Heydrich and the subsequent search for the British-trained Czech patriots who killed him. As German forces scoured the countryside, the apparently insignificant village of Lidice came to bear the brunt of their rage. Starring Timothy Bottoms, Martin Shaw, Joss Ackland, Nicola Pagett, Anton Diffring and Anthony Andrews. Edited for language and violence.(n)

programme.title: The Four Feathers
programme.desc: A crisis of conscience prompts an officer to resign from the military, earning him the disdain of his friends and peers - so in an attempt to win back their respect, he embarks on a perilous undercover mission in the Sudan. Historical adventure based on the classic tale by AEW Mason, starring Heath Ledger, Wes Bentley, Kate Hudson and Djimon Hounsou. Includes 5 News Update at 4.50pm.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Documentary examining the history of famous buildings, beginning by going behind the scenes of the royal residence, which is presently the official London residence of, among others, the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, and Prince Harry. The palace is also where Queen Victoria was born and raised, and was converted into a heavy artillery base during the Second World War, when it also saw a German POW camp established in the grounds.(n)

programme.title: Inside Buckingham Palace
programme.desc: Although it is closed and secretive, Buckingham Palace has become a symbol of everything British, despite only being a royal palace for less that 200 years. This second of two programmes reflects on previous monarchs' accomplishments during their reign, from Edward VII's commitment in 1901 to making the palace a royal stage, to George V's decision to change the family name from Saxe-Coburg-Gotha to Windsor. Finally, the programme considers the next King, who could bring about another revolution at the palace and change its role further in the future.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Disobedient Dogs Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos featuring rebellious dogs doing bizarre and humorous things.(n)

programme.title: The Michael McIntyre Story
programme.desc: Documentary about the comedian's rise to fame, examining the influence of his fellow comedian father on his early routines before his eventual breakthrough performance at the 2006 Royal Variety show. The programme also explores how he has been involved in series that have reinvented stand-up comedy on TV, including Live at the Apollo and Comedy Roadshow.(n)

programme.title: 20 Moments
programme.desc: The countdown of memorable moments from the comedy scene draws to a close, with examples from both sides of the Atlantic. Highlighted are the launches of the raucous 1980s student sitcom The Young Ones and the satirical puppet show Spitting Image, the controversy surrounding Monty Python's Life of Brian, and the much deplored `Sachsgate' scandal of 2008, which saw the tide of public opinion turn against popular BBC presenters Russell Brand and Jonathan Ross after they played an ill-conceived prank on Fawlty Towers star Andrew Sachs live on air on Radio 2. The show also highlights more poignant moments, including Joan Rivers' trail-blazing debut on The Tonight Show back in 1965, and Tommy Cooper's death while live on stage in 1985. Featuring David Baddiel, Keith Allen, Jim Davidson, Jenny Eclair and Nina Wadia.(n)

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: An Oscar-winning Halle Berry stars as the Death Row widow who shares her grief and her bed with prison guard Billy Bob Thornton. Powerful drama with Heath Ledger(n)

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Astronomer Zane discovers an alien radio signal and when he tries to report it he unearths a sinister conspiracy(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Comic road movie starring Wesley Snipes and Patrick Swayze about three New York drag queens who win a trip to Hollywood and set out on a life-changing journey across the USA(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Best friends Liv and Emma discover their dream weddings have been booked at the same venue on the same date and an epic catfight ensues(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned men start a frat house, then run afoul of the dean. Luke Wilson and Will Ferrell star in this uneven "Animal House" rip-off from director Todd Phillips, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: A failed actor turned drama teacher attempts to make a splash by staging a controversial sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as Nathaniel Ayers, a former violin prodigy whose bouts with schizophrenia landed him on the streets after two years of schooling at Juilliard. Steve Lopez is a disenchanted journalist dealing with a recent divorce. Steve is wandering through Los Angeles' Skid Row when he spots Ayers. The more Steve learns about Ayers, the more he longs to help the troubled soul(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: A woman on the lam with her young daughter takes drastic steps when her abusive husband tracks them down(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex . Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: A lab-created human/alien hybrid goes on a killing spree while searching for a man who can impregnate her. Meanwhile, the scientist responsible for her creation brings together a motley crew in order to stop her(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: A trio of American astronauts become instant heroes as they plant the Stars and Stripes on Mars before beginning the voyage home. But back on their ship, something else has set its sights on Earth... something whose relatives have already paid us a visit(n)

programme.title: Species: The Awakening
programme.desc: Miranda, a beautiful college professor, awakens from a blackout and is surrounded by dead bodies. She learns she is an alien/ human hybrid, and must travel to Mexico to find her creator before she can no longer contain her lethal urges(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A young couple are terrorized by three masked intruders at a secluded country house in this grimly efficient exercise in horror and suspense(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Samuel L Jackson plays the eponymous hero in John Singleton's tough thriller, an ex-cop who sets out to nail Walter Wade Jnr., a killer using his rich kid connections to escape conviction. But as Shaft's net draws tighter, he has to contend with killers employed by a desperate Wade(n)

programme.title: The Wrestler
programme.desc: Mickey Rourke is a fading pro-wrestler struggling to adjust to life outside the ring in this Oscar-winning 2008 movie. Marisa Tomei co-stars(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Voyage
programme.desc: When a brilliant scientist is shot, only one way remains to save him: a submarine is shrunk to fit inside the man's bloodstream. But the internal world is as wild as the ocean and there's a saboteur on board(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster in this uproarious comedy(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic science fiction thriller, about a detective who works for a police department that uses three infallible psychics to help convict murderers before they have actually committed their crimes. When the detective discovers that he has been identified as a future killer, he becomes a fugitive from his own colleagues. Based on a short story by Philip K Dick. Starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow, Steve Harris, Neal McDonough(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: A mysterious wanderer looks for dry land after Earth is engulfed by water(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Kevin Costner gives a sensitive performance in this intriguing thriller about a doctor who tries to communicate with his dead spouse. After his wife dies while on a Red Cross mission, a man (Costner) is plagued by what he believes are messages from her, and tries to decipher what they mean. Kathy Bates, Joe Morton, Ron Rifkin, Linda Hunt, Susanna Thompson, Jacob Vargas(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A disturbing videotape appears to hold the power of life and death over those who view it in this offbeat thriller. A strange videotape begins making the rounds in a town in the Pacific Northwest; it is full of bizarre and haunting images, and after watching it, many viewers receive a telephone call in which they are warned they will die in seven days. A handful of teenagers who watched the tape while spending a weekend at a cabin in the mountains scoff at the threat, but as predicted, they all die suddenly on the same night. Rachel Keller (Naomi Watts), the aunt of one of the ill-fated teens, is a journalist who has decided to investigate the matter and travels West with her young son, Aidan (David Dorfman), a troubled child who has been drawing pictures of strange and ominous visions. Rachel managed to find the cabin in the woods and watches the video herself; afterward, she receives the same phone call, and realizes she must solve the puzzle of the video and the person or persons behind it within a week. Rachel turns to her ex, Noah (Martin Henderson), an expert in video technology, who at first is convinced the story is a hoax until he digs deeper into the mystery. The Ring was adapted from a 1996 Japanese film by Hideo Nakata, which became a massive box-office success in Asia and spawned two sequels(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: A hit man is forced to commit three difficult killings in order to rescue his kidnapped lover(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: A gripping drama based on the true story of the mission to rescue 33 miners who were trapped in a underground mine for 69 days(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: In this thrilling fourth installment of the "Jurassic Park" franchise, two young brothers visit an aunt who's an executive at Jurassic World, a theme park populated with genetically resurrected dinosaurs. But chaos erupts when a newly created dino escapes its enclosure, forcing the park's animal behaviorist to save the day(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In the next installment of the "Maze Runner" franchise Thomas (Dylan O'Brien), Teresa (Kaya Scodelario) and the rest of the Gladers search for clues about WCKD, a powerful organization in the Scorch, a bleak landscape that is filled with dangerous obstacles. The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. Directed by Wes Ball who previously directed the original film, The Maze Runner. Cast includes Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Giancarlo Esposito, Aidan Gillen, Ki Hong Lee, Barry Pepper, Lili Taylor and Patricia Clarkson(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Tom Cruise returns as both producer and agent Ethan Hunt in his second action-adventure adaptation of the television series. Directed by John Woo, the action speeds across the continents, as Ethan accepts his latest mission: retrieve and destroy the supply of a genetically modified disease called Chimera, as well as recover the cure, Bellerophon, from of a group of terrorists led by Sean Ambrose. For the mission to succeed, Ethan must persuade jewel thief Nyah Hall to join him, which he does by nearly running her car off a cliff. When Nyah becomes infected with the disease, Ethan must battle to save the woman he now loves, even if that means sending her into enemy territory, and the hands of her ex-boyfriend. Also starring Ving Rhames. Edited for violence and language(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: Randall "Memphis" Raines, a retired car thief, is drawn back into action when a crime lord threatens to whack Raines' brother unless the thief steals 50 top-model cars within 72 hours. Raines recruits a crew of fellow carjackers, including an old pro and an old flame, and the race is on(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Voyage
programme.desc: When a brilliant scientist is shot, only one way remains to save him: a submarine is shrunk to fit inside the man's bloodstream. But the internal world is as wild as the ocean and there's a saboteur on board(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster in this uproarious comedy(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic science fiction thriller, about a detective who works for a police department that uses three infallible psychics to help convict murderers before they have actually committed their crimes. When the detective discovers that he has been identified as a future killer, he becomes a fugitive from his own colleagues. Based on a short story by Philip K Dick. Starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow, Steve Harris, Neal McDonough(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: A mysterious wanderer looks for dry land after Earth is engulfed by water(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Kevin Costner gives a sensitive performance in this intriguing thriller about a doctor who tries to communicate with his dead spouse. After his wife dies while on a Red Cross mission, a man (Costner) is plagued by what he believes are messages from her, and tries to decipher what they mean. Kathy Bates, Joe Morton, Ron Rifkin, Linda Hunt, Susanna Thompson, Jacob Vargas(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A disturbing videotape appears to hold the power of life and death over those who view it in this offbeat thriller. A strange videotape begins making the rounds in a town in the Pacific Northwest; it is full of bizarre and haunting images, and after watching it, many viewers receive a telephone call in which they are warned they will die in seven days. A handful of teenagers who watched the tape while spending a weekend at a cabin in the mountains scoff at the threat, but as predicted, they all die suddenly on the same night. Rachel Keller (Naomi Watts), the aunt of one of the ill-fated teens, is a journalist who has decided to investigate the matter and travels West with her young son, Aidan (David Dorfman), a troubled child who has been drawing pictures of strange and ominous visions. Rachel managed to find the cabin in the woods and watches the video herself; afterward, she receives the same phone call, and realizes she must solve the puzzle of the video and the person or persons behind it within a week. Rachel turns to her ex, Noah (Martin Henderson), an expert in video technology, who at first is convinced the story is a hoax until he digs deeper into the mystery. The Ring was adapted from a 1996 Japanese film by Hideo Nakata, which became a massive box-office success in Asia and spawned two sequels(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: A hit man is forced to commit three difficult killings in order to rescue his kidnapped lover(n)

Cat and Kryten take off in Blue Midget, while Lister and Rimmer make their escape in Starbug, but are marooned when it is hit by a meteor and crash lands on an icy planet. Comedy first aired in 1989, starring Chris Barrie and Craig Charles.(n)

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A grotesque, salivating genetic mutant goes on the rampage aboard the ship, spreading terror and stealing the crew's emotions, leaving Lister without fear and Rimmer with no anger. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Frances Barber.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are in Russia as the motoring magazine returns, taking part in a race across the urban landscape of St Petersburg. James defends the honour of the car in a very small Renault, Richard tries to prove that pedalling is faster by riding a bicycle, while Jeremy attempts to demonstrate that water is the quickest way across town by piloting a hovercraft. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. Plus, the new Lamborghini Huracan is put through its paces and singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran takes to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.(n)

programme.title: Time to Remember
programme.desc: Archive newsreels and voice-overs from the 1950s television series A Time to Remember are combined to tell the story of groundbreaking aviators who took to the skies in the early years of the 20th century. Includes footage of the Wright brothers at Kittyhawke, the German Zeppelins, the R101 disaster and Charles Lindbergh's first solo transatlantic flight in the Spirit of St Louis in 1927. Narrated by Lesley Sharp.(n)

programme.title: Time to Remember
programme.desc: Archive footage of theatres, music halls and cinemas from the 1920s and 30s is combined with narrated reminiscences to shed light on the entertainment industry of the early 20th century. Includes reels of Charles Laughton applying his own stage make-up, chorus line auditions, Mary Pickford and Douglas Fairbanks' trip to Europe, and Alfred Hitchcock's 1929 release Blackmail. Narrated by Lesley Sharp.(n)

programme.title: Battle Castle with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Documentary exploring medieval fortifications and the sieges they resisted, re-enacting battles that changed the course of history. programme.title: A Fine Romance

programme.title: The Lost World

Maverick Professor Challenger leads the quest for a mythical plateau, aiming to prove his theory that dinosaurs still roam certain parts of the Earth.(n)

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Trapped on the plateau, Edward, Agnes and Lord Roxton set out in search of professors Challenger and Summerlee, following their capture by the strange apemen who may provide the missing link between modern man and prehistoric life. But when they mount a rescue, the explorers are confronted by a tribe of Indians. Conclusion of the adventure, starring Bob Hoskins, Peter Falk and James Fox.(n)

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Fifteen Streets
programme.desc: Feature-length drama based on Catherine Cookson's novel set in early 20th-century Newcastle. Worker John O'Brien lives near poverty in a small house in the workers district, yet falls in love with teacher Mary, daughter of a rich family. Despite the pressures exerted by the social difference, the vigorous Mary refuses to allow outer circumstances destroy their relationship. Starring Sean Bean and Clare Holman.(n)

programme.title: A Fine Romance
programme.desc: Mike is thrilled when Laura returns from the dentist a little light-headed and feeling flirtatious. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Michael Williams.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad investigates a long-running feud between two family ice-cream businesses, which resulted in a shooting and several armed raids 10 years ago. With Dennis Waterman and Amanda Redman, alongside guest star Jodie Kelly.(n)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Meanwhile, Harry meets Wade's sister Miriam and agrees to help find her brother's killer. Forensic crime drama, starring William Gaminara, Emilia Fox and Tom Ward, with Juliet Aubrey, Gillian Kearney and Jaye Griffiths.(n)

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: The French Intelligence Service asks for MI5's help in catching an arms expert suspected of trying to sell Eurofighter technology to the highest bidder. It seems a 14-year-old thief holds the key to acquiring the information, but the operation slides into disarray when the government orders the British team to acquire it for themselves, turning an exercise in international co-operation into a web of lies and mistrust. programme.sub-title: What Lies Beneath: The Mick Fanning Story
programme.desc: What Lies Beneath: The Mick Fanning Story. programme.title: The Sports Reporters

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: What on Earth Is Wrong with Gravity?.
programme.desc: Physicist Dr Brian Cox tries to solve the centuries-old mystery of gravity. Unconventionally competing with Newton and Einstein, he starts in Texas, firing a laser at the moon, before moving on to a sat-nav in Denver and a Louisiana swamp. The real issues are in the area of quantum physics for, as he discovers, that is the science of absolutely everything.(n)

programme.title: Finding Life Beyond Earth
programme.desc: Part one of two. Recent telescope images are combined with CGI technology to illustrate the sights and sounds of alien worlds. Powerful modern telescopes and unmanned space missions have revealed a wide range of dynamic environments, prompting scientists to expand their ideas about the possibility that life may be present elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Finding Life Beyond Earth
programme.desc: Conclusion. Foremost astrobiologists explain how the latest telescope images and feedback from unmanned space missions are extending the possibility that life may exist elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Geologist Professor Iain Stewart examines key moments in the development of the world's major land masses. He begins by looking at how Africa was formed from the wreckage of a long-lost supercontinent, with its landmarks, mineral wealth and wildlife providing clues that help piece together the story of its creation. He also reveals how this deep history has left its mark on modern day Africa and the world.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines Australia and reveals how its formation and development has affected everything from Aboriginal history to modern-day mining, and even the evolution of its unique wildlife. He travels to the Great Australian Bight to show how the country was once joined to Antarctica, and how the koala's big, round face and fluffy ears are a result of adaptations to the change of climate after the two land masses split.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines clues hidden in the landscape to reveal how the Americas were formed from an ancient supercontinent, later named Pangaea. He finds evidence that 300 million years ago New York was at the heart of a huge mountain range, and travels to an extinct volcano in Bolivia to explore subduction - the process that has shaped South America.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines key moments in the development of Eurasia, which is the combined continental land mass of Europe and Asia and was formed by a series of tectonic-plate collisions over millions of years. In Kerala, a freshwater fish provides evidence that Madagascar was once joined to India, which created the Himalayas as it pushed its way 4,000km north to its present position.(n)

programme.desc: Conclusion. Foremost astrobiologists explain how the latest telescope images and feedback from unmanned space missions are extending the possibility that life may exist elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Geologist Professor Iain Stewart examines key moments in the development of the world's major land masses. He begins by looking at how Africa was formed from the wreckage of a long-lost supercontinent, with its landmarks, mineral wealth and wildlife providing clues that help piece together the story of its creation. He also reveals how this deep history has left its mark on modern day Africa and the world.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines Australia and reveals how its formation and development has affected everything from Aboriginal history to modern-day mining, and even the evolution of its unique wildlife. He travels to the Great Australian Bight to show how the country was once joined to Antarctica, and how the koala's big, round face and fluffy ears are a result of adaptations to the change of climate after the two land masses split.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines clues hidden in the landscape to reveal how the Americas were formed from an ancient supercontinent, later named Pangaea. He finds evidence that 300 million years ago New York was at the heart of a huge mountain range, and travels to an extinct volcano in Bolivia to explore subduction - the process that has shaped South America.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines key moments in the development of Eurasia, which is the combined continental land mass of Europe and Asia and was formed by a series of tectonic-plate collisions over millions of years. In Kerala, a freshwater fish provides evidence that Madagascar was once joined to India, which created the Himalayas as it pushed its way 4,000km north to its present position.(n)

programme.title: Finding Life Beyond Earth
programme.desc: Part one of two. Recent telescope images are combined with CGI technology to illustrate the sights and sounds of alien worlds. Powerful modern telescopes and unmanned space missions have revealed a wide range of dynamic environments, prompting scientists to expand their ideas about the possibility that life may be present elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Finding Life Beyond Earth
programme.desc: Conclusion. Foremost astrobiologists explain how the latest telescope images and feedback from unmanned space missions are extending the possibility that life may exist elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: A look at some of the world's strongest creatures.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Machine
programme.desc: A 2008 documentary in which Professor Brian Cox visits Geneva to look around Cern's Large Hadron Collider - the world's most powerful particle collider - before the apparatus goes live. He explains why some scientists believe the experiment will be able to recreate the conditions that existed a billionth of a second after the Big Bang, and reveal some of the mysteries of creation.(n)

programme.title: Unseen Universe
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary offering an insight into natural phenomena that can't always be seen with the naked eye. Scientists use state-of-the-art slow-motion cameras to explore what is really happening during an explosion, how dogs move and how different birds of prey fly.(n)

programme.title: Unseen Universe
programme.sub-title: In the Blink of an Eye.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Scientists use state-of-the-art slow-motion cameras to explore what is really happening when a bee hovers, a boxer punches and a small bird flies.(n)

programme.title: Unseen Universe
programme.desc: Part one of two. Slow-motion cameras capture what happens when a caterpillar metamorphoses into a butterfly and scrutinise the movements of acrobats in a circus.(n)

programme.title: Unseen Universe
programme.desc: Part two of two. The slow-motion cameras explore what is really happening in a cave full of bats, capture one of the fastest fish on Earth and scrutinise butterflies.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: How Many People Can Live on Planet Earth?.
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the consequences of human population growth - from 2.5 billion in 1950 to seven billion today - both on people and the environment. While most of this increase has come from developing countries, studies suggest western lifestyles take an unfair share of the planet's resources, as the naturalist argues that a change in the way we live and even smaller families might be needed if mankind is to survive on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Signs
programme.desc: As alien beings threaten Earth's cities, former preacher Graham Hess and his family retreat into their farmhouse and prepare for a very close encounter(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland
programme.desc: The walls of time and space break down in this rollicking sci-fi adventure, in which an ambitious teen discovers a pin that transports her to a futuristic world. She then teams up with a jaded genius, and they embark on a mission to save the Earth(n)

programme.title: Down to You
programme.desc: Whimsical romantic comedy about two college students, Al and Imogen, who fall in love. However, a youthful fear of commitment threatens to destabilise their romance, and when Imogen gets an opportunity to study elsewhere, Al breaks up the relationship - only to realise that he has made a huge mistake(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
programme.desc: In the final instalment of the buccaneering trilogy, Jack Sparrow is trapped in Davy Jones's Locker, and in his absence the East India Trading Company is taking over the seas. Jack's former crew and his friends Elizabeth and Will must join forces with Captain Barbossa to save Captain Sparrow and bring the entire pirate community together against their common enemy. The scene is set for a high-seas battle of epic proportions(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland
programme.desc: The walls of time and space break down in this rollicking sci-fi adventure, in which an ambitious teen discovers a pin that transports her to a futuristic world. She then teams up with a jaded genius, and they embark on a mission to save the Earth(n)

programme.title: Rocky
programme.desc: Uplifting, Oscar-winning drama about a small-time boxer from Philadelphia who - against all odds - gets a shot at his ultimate dream, the heavyweight championship of the world(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: Sequel to the 1976 Oscar-winning favourite which catapulted Sylvester Stallone to megastardom. Things are looking grim for Philadelphia boxer Rocky Balboa. His wife is in a post-natal coma and he has an eye injury that could cost him his sight. But heavyweight champion Apollo Creed's pride is still smarting from their first bout, and he wants a rematch with the Italian Stallion(n)

programme.title: Rocky III
programme.desc: After suffering a humiliating defeat at the hands of hungry young boxer Clubber Lang, Rocky is rejuvenated by his former rival Apollo Creed, who trains Rocky for a rematch against the fearsome mohawked rival, and helps him regain "the eye of the tiger."(n)

programme.title: Rocky IV
programme.desc: Rocky packs another punch in a bout against a Soviet named Drago(n)

programme.title: Rocky V
programme.desc: Touted upon its release as the finale of the Rocky saga, this fifth entry in the long-running series of sports dramas reunites star Sylvester Stallone with John G. Avildsen, director of the Oscar-winning original. Stallone is Rocky Balboa, suffering from career-ending brain damage as a result of his punishing bout with Ivan Drago at the finale of the previous film. Upon their return to Philadelphia, Rocky and his wife, Adrian (Talia Shire), discover they are broke, their fortune squandered by an incompetent accountant. Forced to move back to their working-class neighborhood, Rocky finds that his only asset is the run-down gym willed to him by Mickey (Burgess Meredith, who appears in new flashback sequences). Resisting big money offered to him by Don King-like boxing promoter George Washington Duke (Richard Gant), Rocky becomes a trainer and finds a talented comer in Tommy Gunn (real-life boxer Tommy Morrison, nephew of John Wayne). Rocky's son (played by Stallone's real-life son Sage Stallone) feels neglected by his father, who lavishes attention on his protégé, but Tommy ultimately turns his back on his mentor to sign a more lucrative deal with Duke, leading to a street-fight showdown(n)

programme.title: Rocky
programme.desc: Uplifting, Oscar-winning drama about a small-time boxer from Philadelphia who - against all odds - gets a shot at his ultimate dream, the heavyweight championship of the world(n)

programme.title: Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The true story of the formation of the Texas Rangers provides the backdrop for this youth-oriented Western. In 1875, after the Civil War, Leander McNelly (Dylan McDermott) organizes the Texas Rangers to battle the outlaws terrorizing Texas, notably crime kingpin John King Fisher (Alfred Molina). With a team of experienced gunmen (Robert Patrick and Randy Travis) and enthusiastic but green recruits (James Van Der Beek, Usher Raymond, and Ashton Kutcher), McNelly and his Rangers bring law and order to the wild Texas plains; McNelly must also keep order among his charges when two rangers fall in love with the same woman, Caroline Dukes (Rachael Leigh Cook). Tom Skerritt and Vincent Spano are also featured in the supporting cast; the screenplay, adapted from a script by John Milius, was at one time set to be filmed by Sam Peckinpah, shortly before the legendary Western director's death in 1984(n)

programme.title: The Jackie Robinson Story
programme.desc: This documentary chronicles the life of Jackie Robinson, the first African American professional baseball player. Robinson's courage of conviction and the support of his family and friends enabled him to cross the color barrier in baseball, Robinson challenged his critics and the naysayers to accept him as he was: a man, an athlete, and a very talented baseball player. This bio-picture stars Jackie Robinson and features his story of working his way through the Negro Leagues and entering Major League Baseball. Jackie Robinson shined in his career and established himself as a role model for other athletes that followed. This motion picture also stars the very talented Ruby Dee as Nancy Robinson(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: After a team of potential players has been recruited, former player Jimmy Dugan coaches the girls and prepares them for the World Series(n)

programme.title: Fever Pitch
programme.desc: Ben (Jimmy Fallon) must choose between his love for Lindsey (Drew Barrymore) and the baseball team he supports, the Boston Red Sox. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch and released in America under that title, the two leads bring the same warmth and humour to their roles as their British counterparts. Even sports fans unfamiliar with baseball will know the pain that comes from attending an important function when your team are playing a crucial match(n)

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: Fact-based sports tale stars Dennis Quaid as Jim Morris, a high-school teacher and coach who makes it to the Major Leagues as a 35-year-old relief pitcher(n)

programme.title: For Love of the Game
programme.desc: A baseball legend almost finished with his distinguished career at the age of thirty-seven has one last chance to prove who he is, what he is capable of and win the heart of the woman he has loved for the past four years. As he pitches that night, he must decide whether to accept the trade or quit the game he loves, and between innings, he recalls meeting Jane, their first date, happy times, miscommunication, and what may be a final break. Meanwhile, with Vin Scully announcing, one Yankee batter after another fails to reach first base. Can Billy pitch a perfect game, and if so, what does it matter if he loses Jane?(n)

programme.title: The Natural
programme.desc: Robert Redford in the Bernard Malamud saga of a baseball player with magic in his bat(n)

programme.title: Bull Durham
programme.desc: The story of a minor-league North Carolina baseball team (the Triple A Durham Bulls) and its attentive, intelligent groupie who feels it is her mission to live with one young player per season and help him mature(n)

programme.title: Godzilla 2000
programme.desc: Following Roland Emmerich's controversial Americanization of the Japanese monster icon in Godzilla (1998), the Beast from the East comes roaring back in this sci-fi adventure tale. Yuji Shinoda (Naomi Nishida), a scientist devoted to researching Godzilla, is setting up equipment on a fog-shrouded peninsula with her daughter Io (Mayu Suzuki) and journalist Yuki Ichinose (Takehiro Murata) when everyone's favorite 180-foot-tall lizard appears from the sea and begins laying siege to a nuclear power plant. The military swings into action, but the monster's fiery breath soon uncovers an alien spacecraft; beings from outer space have come to take over the earth, and now Godzilla is our last line of defense against them. Hugely successful in Japan, Gojira Mireniamu (aka Godzilla 2000) was the first Japanese Godzilla movie since Godzilla 1985 to receive a US theatrical release(n)

programme.title: Godzilla vs. Megaguirus
programme.desc: The Big Green Guy launches yet another attack on Japan, but this time the humans are prepared for him---though not for the arrival of a second monster. Misato Tanaka, Shosuki Tanihara. Motohiko: Masato Ibu. Yoshino: Yuriko Hoshi(n)

programme.title: Godzilla, Mothra and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All-Out Attack
programme.desc: After sandblasting away years of camp and bad scripts from the Gamera franchise to form a couple of tight-scripted, vastly entertaining flicks, Shusuke Kaneko gives the same treatment to the granddaddy of kaiju eiga characters: Godzilla. The film opens with Godzilla waking up from his underwater hideaway. Unseen since his 1954 attack on Tokyo, the monster is spotted by a Japanese submarine. Though government officials seem reluctant to confront the problem, Navy Admiral Tachibana (Ryudo Uzaki), who witnessed the rampage when he was a child, is more than a little alarmed. Meanwhile, Tachibana's daughter Yuri (Chiharu Niiyama), who works at a struggling TV station, is making a documentary in the mountains of Niigata Prefecture. One night, they experience a massive earthquake and that next morning they learn that a gang of motorcycle punks were crushed in a mountain tunnel and witnesses reportedly saw some sort of fire-breathing creature in the rubble. Later, a group of campers in southern Kagoshima prefecture are crushed by some Thing that crawled out of Lake Ikeda. Soon Japan is awash with monsters -- including Baradon, a monster that looks like a pug terrier with Mickey Mouse ears, and King Gidora, a three-headed beast with a lethal 50-meter tail -- busting up things north, south, east, and west(n)

programme.title: Godzilla Against Mechagodzilla
programme.desc: A Japanese scientist (Shin Takuma) creates a giant cyborg creature to do battle with the prehistoric beast. Yumiko Shaku. Directed by Masaaki Tezuka(n)

programme.title: Godzilla: Tokyo S.O.S.
programme.desc: Masaki Tezuka directs his third thrilling installment in the ongoing saga of the monster-lizard menace, whose impending return threatens Japan once again, at a time when his robotic foe, Mechagodzilla, is out of commission. Noboru Kaneko, Hiroshi Koizumi, Miho Yoshioka, Katsuya Onizuka, Masami Nagasawa, Chihiro Otsuka(n)

programme.title: Godzilla: Final Wars
programme.desc: Godzilla teams up with Mothra to save the Earth from aliens and an army of evil creatures, including Rodan and Gigan(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man and his son on a fishing trip hook what appears to be the body of a petty officer, but the dead man turns out to be a journalist who had been investigating the proliferation of drugs in the Navy. Meanwhile, Ziva returns to her car after a workout at the gym to find her father Eli hiding inside. Guest starring Michael Nouri.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Conclusion. After the deaths of two family members of NCIS employees, the team identifies the killer as a Swedish mercenary and the ballistics report reveals the bullets came from an Iranian arms dealer. McGee traces a wire transfer made to the hitman's ex-wife and son to an account under the name Virtue, and Ziva makes a connection after realising what the Hebrew translation is.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called to the scene of a fatal car crash involving marine lance corporal Chad Dunn and student Lyla Cutwright. Duckie notices that the woman's injuries do not match the specifics of the accident and there are no skidmarks found at the scene, leading Gibbs to declare they possibly have a murder and a suicide on their hands. Abby calls in sick for the first time after the case stirs up a traumatic incident from her childhood. Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team capture computer hacker Ajay Khan, who was recently responsible for hacking into NCIS's supposedly ultra-secure multiple-threat alert centre. They believe he could hold the key to tracking down the most-wanted cyber terrorist in the world, who may be plotting an attack using a bomb containing a strain of the Ebola virus. When Khan refuses to co-operate, Ziva and DiNozzo take him to Guantanamo Bay to be placed with people he had previously betrayed. Guest starring Vik Sahay (Chuck).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the case of a marine who dropped dead while scaling a wall on an assault course, and a fellow soldier reveals that he was heavily involved with an underground fight club, where competitors would battle for cash. Meanwhile, having returned to work after compassionate leave, Vance discovers paperwork and a key in his late wife's effects that lead him to a safety deposit box containing a stash of cash.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs assumes a former alias to infiltrate an infamous anti-government militia. Meanwhile, Bishop and Reeves team up in an off-the-books investigation.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Palmer faces a dilemma during a hit-and-run investigation when he spots a stranger standing on a ledge, and places his own life in peril in an attempt to get the man down to safety.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The wife of a man who Danny helped to convict for manslaughter arrives at the TAC offices with a bomb, and takes the team hostage to force Bull to prove her husband's innocence.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: An investigation is launched into the murder of a psychiatrist involved in the trial of a drug designed to treat teenage depression and anxiety. Meanwhile, Brenda's squad learns she was charged with sexual misconduct in her previous job in Atlanta. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates when the daughter of a congresswoman is raped and murdered in her home, and is drawn into a seedy underworld. The evidence prompts her to examine the victim's sexual predilections - and uncovers a secret that could make her the next victim. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda is called on to investigate when a judge is carjacked and murdered. Despite having a long list of witnesses, the one person she's certain can help is the victim's autistic son.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The murder of a gay man stirs political tension in the city, and Chief Pope tasks Brenda with bringing the killer to justice. However, she also has to contend with internal conflicts in the department, as Taylor undermines her authority and a team member actively works against her.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The daughter of a wealthy family's housekeeper is raped and murdered, and the authorities are quick to point the finger of blame at a known sex offender. However, Brenda is convinced there is more to the case than meets the eye, and struggles to overcome her own beliefs and concoct a logical explanation. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: 24: Legacy
programme.desc: Carter turns to Andy for help in reclaiming a crucial piece of evidence. Meanwhile, Rebecca seeks external assistance when CTU's regular interrogation techniques prove unsuccessful.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg convinces Brian to take her SATs for her, but when she receives poor exam results everyone begins to question how smart the dog really is. Peter spends the day with the canine, showing him all the joys of being stupid, and the benefits of having a low IQ.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg is thrilled to be recruited as a model - but not everything is as it seems with the job. Meanwhile, Brian accompanies Stewie on a road trip adventure when the baby decides he wants to experience life outside of preschool.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian and Stewie use a hi-tech remote control to visit alternative realities, including a post-apocalyptic world run by dogs with humans as their pets and the Robot Chicken universe. Animation, featuring the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois goes to see the family doctor, who looks into her history and discovers she is Jewish, a revelation that pleases Peter - until a visit from the spirit of his dead father changes his mind.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan finds out his half-brother Rusty (guest voice Lou Diamond Phillips) is wealthier than him when the family gathers for Thanksgiving, and takes extreme measures to recover what he thinks is rightfully his.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is awaiting his annual jury summons, but there is trouble ahead when becomes the foreman in a trial where Roger is the defendant. Meanwhile, Jeff and Hayley move in with the Smiths, and Francine tries to get Jeff to clean up his act.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie and Brian discover the people who moved in to Cleveland's old house are spies, and follow them on a mission to Russia. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Alex Borstein.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Brian's Got a Brand New Bag.
programme.desc: Brian starts dating an older woman, but she has an accident and breaks her hip, forcing him to become her unofficial errand boy - and prompting the couple to re-evaluate their relationship.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: For Whom the Sleigh Bell Tolls.
programme.desc: Against Francine's advice, Stan decides to give Steve a gun for Christmas, but when the teenager accidentally shoots Santa dead, the whole festive season is under threat.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The Smiths are forced to move into a hotel following an incident in which Roger released lethal gas into their home. However, Francine soon becomes bored with her new surroundings and decides to assume the identity of a businesswoman.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie befriends a teenage pop star, but discovers a surprising secret about her. Meanwhile, Chris tries to convince his family that the evil monkey in his wardrobe is real. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth MacFarlane, Mila Kunis and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Quagmire takes parental responsibility for a baby who looks like him, but realises he may not be suitable for fatherhood, and Stewie clones himself so that he can have a personal assistant.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan and Francine's social life gets a boost when they meet adventurous couple Tom and Cami, but they realise they cannot keep up with them. However, it isn't long before they devise a plan to slow them down permanently.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger invites Stan to attend one of his acting classes, but tempers flare when they both audition for the same role. Meanwhile, Steve and his friends plan to say goodbye to their childhoods by arranging the greatest sleepover ever.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Florida engage in an undercover operation against the sale of illegal pills at pain management clinics, while cops in Texas deal with a major traffic accident.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An Amarillo officer is forced to chase a woman on-foot after questioning her about her suspicious late-night behaviour. Meanwhile, a patrol in Florida deals with a brawl.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While transporting the corpse of Lt Gordon Roth to the morgue, a flat tyre brings Ducky and Jimmy to a halt and they are abducted and taken to a remote cabin - where one of their captors wants the post-mortem to take place. Back at the scene, Abby finds a blood sample that does not belong to the victim, who in fact bore little resemblance to the picture of Roth in his old school yearbook. Guest starring Valerie Cruz (The Following).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is stabbed to death after stepping out of her shower, becoming the latest victim of the Dead Rose Slasher. Gibbs is approached by his old friend and barber Frankie Dean, who shares his concern that his son Cameron may be the killer. He explains that a photo-fit released to the media resembles him, and the attacks stopped during a period coinciding with his three-year stint in the navy. Meanwhile, Tony has to take probationary agent Ned Dorneget under his wing.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Marine sergeant Teddy Lemere is killed by a sniper in Afghanistan just after his sniffer dog helps guide a young child out of a minefield. Back in the US, his widow Ruby tells Gibbs and the team that she had recently received a message from her husband saying he might have upset a few people. Abby retrieves a tiny shard of the sniper's bullet from Ted's helmet and finds that it was made in America.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A doctor dies on board the USS Borealis during a heavy storm and when the ship is brought into Norfolk Naval Yard, Ducky's investigation reveals a telltale mark on the victim's carotid artery, suggesting he was injected with poison. Initial inquiries focus on a petty officer with a history of drug use who may have wanted the doctor to remain silent about his problems. American drama, starring David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team are called in when a Navy reservist returns home to find her husband missing and her living room covered in blood, and make a grim discovery when they find a finger in the bin. Meanwhile, Ziva ruffles a few feathers by insisting on continuing her investigation into the murder of her father, asking for permission to go to Rome on the trail of the chief suspect. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A wealthy 80-year-old man who recently married a young stripper is found dead and, when his widow dies of an overdose, all eyes turn to the butler. Despite a lack of support from her colleagues, Brenda decides to investigate the victim's three grown-up children instead.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda struggles to gain control of an investigation into the murder of a businessman and is eventually partnered on the case by Fritz. However, she discovers the FBI has ulterior motives, putting their friendship under further strain. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team members are forced to reopen a botched murder investigation from three years previously as they attempt to get a pyromaniac serial killer safely behind bars. Meanwhile, Taylor continues to wage his political war on Brenda's rank. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick and Robert Gossett.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A complaint is filed against Brenda, which threatens her career in the squad, but when Captain Pope offers to help, she is dubious about his intentions. Meanwhile, the detectives are kept busy trying to trace the killer of a Hollywood producer. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The pressure is on for Brenda and her team to solve the murder of a police detective, but as evidence points to one of their own, the Deputy Police Chief struggles to match DNA samples that could prove their case. However, it becomes clear Gabriel and Daniels' relationship to the victim is key to understanding the crime. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: In this exciting sequel, war begins to brew between the human survivors of a deadly plague and a society of genetically evolved apes led by the sage simian Caesar. When their fragile truce collapses, the fight to become the dominant species starts(n)

programme.title: Siege at Red River
programme.desc: Confederate agent James Farraday steals a Gatling gun prototype from the Yankees. But smuggling it south through enemy territory proves more difficult, especially with detective Frank Kelso on his back, treacherous scout Brett Manning double-crossing him, and nurse Nora Curtis to protect. Western, starring Van Johnson, Jeff Morrow and Joanne Dru.(n)

programme.title: Catch That Kid
programme.desc: A plucky teenager racks her brains to think of a way of financing an operation for her father who was injured in a mountaineering accident, and eventually comes up with a daring plan to rob a bank with the help of friends. Comedy adventure, starring Kristen Stewart, Corbin Bleu, Max Thieriot and Jennifer Beals.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Cleo
programme.desc: A captured Briton is mistaken for a heroic swordsman and promoted to the Roman Royal Guard, with orders to protect Julius Caesar. But the last thing he and the fated emperor expect is an assassination attempt from within Caesar's own circle of friends. Comedy, starring Amanda Barrie, Kenneth Williams, Sid James, Kenneth Connor, Jim Dale, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims.(n)

programme.title: Rango
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: Runaway Bride
programme.desc: A disreputable journalist hopes to get his ailing career back on track by writing an article about a commitment-shy woman famed for ditching bridegrooms at the altar - but complications arise when the pair meet on the eve of her latest attempt at marriage. Romantic comedy, starring Julia Roberts and Richard Gere, with Joan Cusack, Hector Elizondo and Rita Wilson.(n)

programme.title: The Wolf of Wall Street
programme.desc: A New York stockbroker rises from unemployment to become one of the richest men in the city's financial elite through an illegal scheme to defraud investors. His wealth brings him an outrageously debauched lifestyle, but comes at a price as the FBI become suspicious of his manipulation of the markets. Martin Scorsese's fact-based drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Jonah Hill and Matthew McConaughey.(n)

programme.title: A Field in England
programme.desc: Three deserters escaping the front line during the English Civil War are taken hostage by an alchemist and his associate. They are forced to help dig for a mythical treasure believed to be buried in a nearby field, but their search unleashes dangerous and disturbing mystical forces. Horror, starring Reece Shearsmith and Michael Smiley.(n)

programme.title: Ben Wheatley Interview Special
programme.desc: The director discusses his film-making career leading up to the release of his Civil War drama A Field in England.(n)

programme.title: Straightheads
programme.desc: A woman and her lover are attacked by a gang while driving down a remote country road, an experience that leaves them traumatised. Later returning to the area in the wake of her father's death, she encounters one of her attackers by chance and sees the opportunity to take revenge. Thriller, starring Gillian Anderson and Danny Dyer.(n)

programme.title: My Darling Clementine
programme.desc: Retired lawman Wyatt Earp accepts the post of Tombstone city marshal when one of his brothers is killed by cattle rustlers, and embarks on a crusade to bring his murderers to justice and drive lawlessness from the streets. Western, directed by John Ford, starring Henry Fonda, Victor Mature, Linda Darnell and Walter Brennan.(n)

programme.title: Love Happens
programme.desc: A self-help guru goes on a lecture tour after his wife's death, offering advice on how to cope with grief. However, when he falls in love he begins to realise he has yet to confront his own loss, while the object of his affection has a troubled past of her own to deal with. Romantic drama, starring Jennifer Aniston, Aaron Eckhart and Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson are asked to protect the last remaining member of the aristocratic Baskerville family, who is believed to be the target of a monstrous spectral hound roaming the remote Devon moors. Hammer version of Arthur Conan Doyle's mystery, starring Peter Cushing, Andre Morrell, Christopher Lee, John Le Mesurier and Miles Malleson.(n)

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: A teenager discovers he is the last in a long line of warriors destined to defend the world from dark forces. His duty now is to embark on a perilous journey through time to recover the six parts of a powerful mystical artefact and ensure it is returned to safe hands. Fantasy adventure, starring Alexander Ludwig, Christopher Eccleston and Ian McShane.(n)

programme.title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off
programme.desc: A cocky teenager plays truant from school and spends the day dragging his girlfriend and a reluctant friend into all manner of crazy adventures in the big city - while the school's dean of students vows to stop at nothing to prove the youngster is faking illness. Comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Mia Sara, Alan Ruck, Jennifer Grey, Jeffrey Jones and Charlie Sheen.(n)

programme.title: Chef
programme.desc: Carl Casper quits his job at a prestigious Los Angeles restaurant after refusing to compromise his creative integrity for the owner, and takes to the road to reignite his passion for the kitchen. He ends up in Miami, where he teams up with his ex-wife, his friend and his son to launch a food truck. Comedy, directed by and starring Jon Favreau. with Robert Downey Jr, Scarlett Johansson and Dustin Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Blood Ties
programme.desc: A police officer in 1970s New York takes in his older brother following his release from prison. The cop tries to help his sibling make a fresh start, finding honest work and reconnecting with the family he lost - but conflict erupts as the elder brother returns to a life of crime. Crime drama, starring Clive Owen, Billy Crudup, Marion Cotillard and James Caan.(n)
