programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's sense of authority begins to wane when the arrival of new neighbour Paul threatens the equilibrium in his community. The first episode of the sitcom, starring Richard Briers as an obsessive middle-aged man who yearns to be at the centre of his local suburban neighbourhood. With Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan. First broadcast in 1984.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Fed up with doing everything himself, Martin hands in his resignation as chairman of the Residents' Association - and to his surprise, it is accepted. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean insists on going back to work having returned from LA, certain she can overcome jet lag, but Lionel just wants to rest. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean tries to organise a new secretary for Lionel, who is troubled by discussions regarding the mini-series. Rocky's honeymoon with Madge ends in hospital after an unfortunate canoeing accident. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part One: The American Dream.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Trotters get a chance to escape Peckham for a holiday in the Florida sun - but it means Del leaving his newborn son behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Buster Merryfield, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong, Denis Lill and Roger Lloyd Pack.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy plans to convert an old boat into a water taxi, but when work is finally completed Compo becomes obsessed with getting Nora Batty on board.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Empire That Foggy Nearly Built.
programme.desc: After witnessing an argument between two motorists over an available space, Foggy hits on another get-rich-quick scheme - this time in the form of a car-parking scheme. Rural comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Last Surviving Maurice Chevalier Impression.
programme.desc: Compo decides the way to win the heart of Nora Batty is to become a celebrity, so goes on a televised talent show. Gorden Kaye ('Allo 'Allo!) guest stars, alongside Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: Joyce and Alan have financial concerns and consider downsizing, but - hoping to keep it quiet for the time being - they don't count on their friends being there when the estate agent arrives to look round. Maureen has finally decided to move elderly mum Joan into a residential home, while the men convince John that his sister-in-law's over-friendly behaviour is actually a form of sexual harassment and, having put up with it for 40 years, he decides it's time he finally spoke up. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and June Whitfield.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: They say age is but a number, and every year Joyce, Alan and the gang like to remind themselves of that by attending a 1960s-themed weekend at a seaside resort, and partying their evenings away. However, this time, Alan's in their bad books, having messed up the booking, leaving them with only two rooms between the six of them. Meanwhile, John is determined to prove he's not old and starts by taking on the climbing wall, and Carol bumps into an old friend, which could spell trouble for her relationship with Trevor. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and Paula Wilcox.(n)

programme.title: Porridge: Inside Out
programme.desc: A look at the making of the prison sitcom, originally shown to coincide with its 40th anniversary. Writers Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais guide cameras around the pivotal places they visited during the creation and development of the series, including the pub where they first met, the prisons they researched, and the filming locations they used. Plus, contributions by the show's admirers, surviving members of the cast and members of the production crew.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barraclough uncover the stash in his cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del's latest foolproof scheme to make a million involves a spot of salmon-poaching, but the wheeler-dealer finds the bracing country air is not all it's cracked up to be. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You.
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters embark on a decorating venture for Denzil. When they find a canary lying dead in its cage, they race to replace it before the deal is ruined. Comedy, with David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: The very first episode of the award-winning comedy kicks off with Edina and Patsy hitting the bottle as they struggle to cope with career and family pressures. Starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina is horrified when Bubble tells her she is about to be visited by Penny Caspar-Morse, an ultra-thin model she knew in the 1960s who used to torment her about her weight. She decides to lose some weight, but abandons her exercise programme and lets Patsy schedule her an appointment to have liposuction. Comedy, guest starring Alexandra Bastedo, with Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina and Patsy set off for a break in the heart of rural Provence, only to find their chateau is nowhere near as luxurious as they were expecting. Comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Eddie and Richie agree to mind their landlord's shop - and end up irritating the locals so much they find themselves facing a gang of looters. John Wells guest stars, alongside Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson as the puerile flatmates.(n)

programme.title: Filthy, Rich and Catflap
programme.desc: Richie plans to profit from his father's death by selling advertising rights for the funeral. When the old man recovers however, the comic takes matters into his own hands.(n)

programme.title: Stewart Lee's Comedy Vehicle
programme.desc: Comedian Stewart Lee looks at the subject of charity, but gets sidetracked into talking about crisps, his grandfather and whether the series is going to have any actual jokes in it. Featuring a guest cameo by Armando Iannucci.(n)

programme.title: Stewart Lee's Comedy Vehicle
programme.desc: The comedian explores the topic of London in stand-up routines filmed at the Mildmay Club in Stoke Newington, north London. The performances are interspersed with clips of script editor Chris Morris grilling the comedian about his ideas and the episode ends with a short film.(n)

programme.title: Eddie Izzard: Force Majeure
programme.desc: A stand-up performance from the comedian, offering a glimpse into the mind of the master surrealist. The show was recorded during Izzard's mammoth 2013-14 tour, which saw him visit 27 countries across the world.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Skits and sketches from comedy duo Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders, with guest star Jane Asher.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Comedy sketches with Dawn and Jennifer, including a parody of Ingmar Bergman's film The Seventh Seal. Guest starring Rowland Rivron.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's suspicions about Paul's bad influence seem to be confirmed when he spots a half-naked woman in next door's back garden. Comedy, starring Richard Briers. First broadcast February 12, 1984.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrews, Mrs Warboys and Nick Swainey spend a day boating on the river, but get marooned - so Victor sets out alone to fetch help and stumbles across a disturbing secret at an old people's home. Richard Wilson stars.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrews return home from a dreary holiday to find the neighbours about to sell their house to a weirdo - and while Victor is busy moaning about everything under the sun, Margaret considers embarking on an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barraclough uncover the stash in his cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You.
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters embark on a decorating venture for Denzil. When they find a canary lying dead in its cage, they race to replace it before the deal is ruined. Comedy, with David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney's Christmas celebrations are disrupted by the unexpected arrival of their estranged father - leaving the brothers doubtful they can trust him after such a long absence. Another chance to see the 1983 festive special of John Sullivan's comedy.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: One of Del's old flames turns up out of the blue, so Rodney and Grandad resolve to extinguish any passion that might still be smouldering in the Peckham wide boy's heart. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del spots another sure-fire winner and decides to enter the highly profitable tourist trade - and with Rodney and Grandad backing him 100 per cent, he is sure his open-top bus tour initiative will be a massive success. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney and Mickey Pearce are commissioned to make a community film, but Del-Boy soon gets in on the act, offering a role to anyone who wants one - provided they pay for the privilege.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney ties the knot with Cassandra, but Del has more on his mind than best man duties as the dreaded Driscoll brothers arrive at the Nag's Head baying for his blood over some stolen mobile phones. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina decides to soak away her worries in a flotation tank and is amazed at its life-changing effects on both herself and those around her - so amazed that she agrees to adopt a Romanian orphan and even attends an open day at Saffron's school. Award-winning comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina takes time out from being PR guru to the country's biggest stars to become involved with Patsy's fashion magazine. Cosmo and Vogue beware - two new lushes are in town. Comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, with guest appearances by Dawn French and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina hits 40 and goes into a panic at the realisation that she now officially has one foot in the grave - so Saffie decides to cheer her up by throwing a party. Unfortunately, the guests fail to get along, and it all ends in tears. Hit comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley, Julia Sawalha and June Whitfield.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Despite being reduced to living in a roadside motel and presenting an early-morning programme on Radio Norwich, Alan still dreams of launching a new show on the BBC. However, his meeting with chief commissioner Tony Hayers does not run smoothly. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Alan faces bankruptcy and is forced to choose between sacking all his staff or keeping a few on but downgrading his car. His choice becomes more complicated when he falls in love with Jill, one of his employees. Sitcom, starring Steve Coogan, with Felicity Montagu, Phil Cornwell, Julia Deakin, Barbara Durkin and Simon Greenall.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace return to put more keen cooks to the test. The first five hopefuls begin by serving up their Calling Card, a dish that showcases their talent - and this year, it carries a prize as the judges' two favourites will sail through to the third round. Then it's new challenge the Reinvention Test, in which they create a new plate of food based on their main ingredient from the first round, before one goes home and the rest cook dinner for a trio of former MasterChef champions.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Five more cooks compete for a place in the quarter-final, preparing a dish that represents who they are, before the three least successful hopefuls rustle up a different plate of food using the same main ingredient in the Reinvention Test. One cook is shown the door, and then the remaining four face the daunting task of preparing dinner for reigning MasterChef champion Ping Coombes and former finalists Jack Lucas and Luke Owen. But which pair will John Torode and Gregg Wallace put through?.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal discovers that curry house classics such as vindaloo, bhuna, phal and onion bhaji were all invented in Britain, as he puts his own stamp on the most famous of them all - injecting whole poussins with tikka marinade and stuffing them with tikka masala. He also rustles up his own version of lamb biryani with a Bombay mix crust, creates giant poppadoms measuring almost a metre wide, and serves a new type of lager - `beeryani', infused with rice and pandan leaves. As a final nod to the British curry house experience, the chef makes a giant After Eight-inspired dessert, and dishes up his unique menu in a pop-up restaurant on the outskirts of Bradford.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal seeks inspiration from the nation's rich history of chocolate-making to create a supersized chocolate bar. With help from leading brands, the chef crafts a homage to several popular treats as part of the first-ever Great Bar of Britain, which he unveils at a feast. He also makes a `Moos bar' - a combination of beef nougat, shortbread biscuit, and beef and Guinness caramel - and a unique range of goodies in an edible box.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall cooks using produce from Britain's abundant spring harvest, including asparagus, artichokes and lamb. The shepherd's pie recipe is taste-tested against Delia Smith's cheat version with surprising results, and five Bristol families are challenged to turn an acre of city land into an urban smallholding. Plus, an update on the Chicken Out! campaign.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall prepares dishes using seasonal lettuce and spinach from his kitchen garden, and dandelion and burdock grown in the hedgerows. The experimental Bristol smallholding receives four saddleback pigs, and vegetarian Susan accepts the task of butchering a whole lamb's carcass. Plus, the chef's country honey is pitted against the city variety at a taste-off in Broadway market.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: The potatoes and radishes are ready for picking and the broad beans are de-podded for a luxurious dish of beans on toast. Jess chooses a batch of hens from a battery egg farm as the Bristol experiment to turn an acre of derelict city land into a smallholding continues. Back at River Cottage, Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall organises a foraging competition and finds his ducklings hatch days early.(n)

This time, our heroes must confront Mr Freeze (Arnold Schwarzenegger), a cold-hearted villain with an icy touch who has teamed up with the desirable yet deadly Poison Ivy (Uma Thurman), a woman with a kiss to die for - literally. programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: Lady in the Water director M. Night Shyamalan puts PG-13 suspense on pause to tell this grim apocalyptic tale about a family fleeing a natural disaster that poses a grave threat to the whole of humanity. Philadelphia high-school science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) is discussing the disappearance of the bees with his students when the staff is summoned to the theater and briefed about a mysterious event that is currently unfolding in New York City. According to reports, citizens in the vicinity of Central Park have suddenly and inexplicably begun seizing up just before killing themselves by whatever means are at their disposal. As the phenomena begins to spread and talk of terrorism fills the airwaves, Elliot, his wife, Alma (Zooey Deschanel), their friend Julian (John Leguizamo), and his daughter, Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez), board a train bound for the presumed safety of the country. When the train screeches to a halt before arriving at its final destination, however, the frightened passengers are forced to fend for themselves as each consecutive news report paints an increasingly grim picture of the situation in more urbanized areas. Theories abound on what could be causing the unexplainable rash of suicides, but the only thing that everyone seems to agree on is that it's some kind of airborne contagion that is carried in the wind. It would appear that humankind's reign on planet Earth has come to an end, but perhaps if this small band of survivors can find a safe place to lie low until this all blows over, all hope for survival of the species might not be lost just yet(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Somebody's Dead. In the premiere of an adaptation of Liane Moriarty's novel set in a seemingly idyllic seaside California town, a suspicious death at an elementary school fund-raiser exposes rivalries simmering beneath the superficial comity among some of the parents(n)

Lion: Harvey Korman. The Boy Who Cried Wolf: Jaleel White. Monsieur Fox: Dabney Coleman. Grape Fox: Melanie Chartoff. Tortoise/Ant: Ruth Brown. Mouse/Grasshopper: Kevin Pollak. Hare: Katey Sagal. programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: Writer and director Robert Rodriguez returns to the family-friendly adventure of his Spy Kids movies with this three-dimensional action opus. Max (Cayden Boyd) is a ten-year-old boy who doesn't get along with his peers and is constantly bullied at school. But Max has an active imagination, and he has a pair of very special imaginary playmates -- Shark Boy (Taylor Lautner), a human-shark half-breed cared for by a pack of great whites, and Lava Girl (Taylor Dooley), a girl with superpowers who can conjure heat and fire at will. Max may be a creative boy, but what he doesn't know is that Shark Boy and Lava Girl really do exist, and he is recruited to help them as they do battle against Mr. Electricity, a super-villain determined to deprive children of their sleep. Shot and originally released in the 3-D format, The Adventures of Shark Boy and Lava Girl also stars David Arquette and Kristin Davis as Max's parents, and George Lopez as a schoolteacher; writer and director Rodriguez wrote the film's story in collaboration with his then seven-year-old son, Racer Rodriguez(n)

programme.title: Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: Writer and director Robert Rodriguez returns to the family-friendly adventure of his Spy Kids movies with this three-dimensional action opus. Max (Cayden Boyd) is a ten-year-old boy who doesn't get along with his peers and is constantly bullied at school. But Max has an active imagination, and he has a pair of very special imaginary playmates -- Shark Boy (Taylor Lautner), a human-shark half-breed cared for by a pack of great whites, and Lava Girl (Taylor Dooley), a girl with superpowers who can conjure heat and fire at will. Max may be a creative boy, but what he doesn't know is that Shark Boy and Lava Girl really do exist, and he is recruited to help them as they do battle against Mr. Electricity, a super-villain determined to deprive children of their sleep. Shot and originally released in the 3-D format, The Adventures of Shark Boy and Lava Girl also stars David Arquette and Kristin Davis as Max's parents, and George Lopez as a schoolteacher; writer and director Rodriguez wrote the film's story in collaboration with his then seven-year-old son, Racer Rodriguez(n)

programme.title: Cocoon: The Return
programme.desc: Daniel Petric rises to the challenge of directing this sequel to Ron Howard's successful original(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Can Mia prove her regal relative wrong?(n)

As Astro Boy grows up, he befriends a gang of scavengers who live in a desolate wasteland on Earth and eventually returns to his hometown of Metro City to protect the populace from a group of dangerous robots(n)

programme.title: The Great Muppet Caper
programme.desc: The Great Muppet Caper is the second Muppet film and it is considerably more complex than its predecessor, The Muppet Movie, which was essentially just a road movie. As the film begins, Kermit the Frog and Fozzie Bear are reporters who have failed to bag a story of a London jewel heist, which happened under their watch. The real criminals managed to escape and frame Miss Piggy as the thief. Kermit, Fozzie and the Great Gonzo set out on a mission to solve the mystery and track down the criminals who stole the Baseball Diamond. There are fewer star cameos and songs in The Great Muppet Caper than in The Muppet Movie, although appearances from John Cleese and Charles Grodin are particularly memorable(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip
programme.desc: Through a series of misunderstandings, Alvin, Simon and Theodore come to believe that Dave is going to propose to his new girlfriend in New York City and dump them. They have three days to get to him and stop the proposal, saving themselves not only from losing Dave but possibly from gaining a terrible stepbrother(n)

programme.title: The Last Mimzy
programme.desc: Chris O'Neil and Rhiannon Leigh Wryn star as siblings Noah and Emma Wilder in Bob Shaye's intelligent family sci-fi adventure drama that doesn't talk down to children. While staying at their family beach house near Seattle, the two find a box of things that look like toys, but prove to be far more mysterious. Sent back in time, the 'toys' are trying to pass on a message about the future. And the more Noah and Emma play with the objects from the box, the more their intelligence grows. But one day Noah lines up the toys and accidentally activates a powerful force that creates a state-wide blackout. With her family under arrest by the FBI, Emma must make sense of the messages Mimzy, the toy rabbit, has been telepathically communicating to her(n)

programme.title: Joe Somebody
programme.desc: Tim Allen, Patrick Warburton and Julie Bowen star in John Pasquin's comedy-drama about a man whose life is changed by a bullying incident. Mild-mannered Joe Scheffer is taking his pre-teen daughter Natalie to a corporate event at his big pharma workplace when an argument over a parking space results in Joe being set upon by a colleague Mark McKinney. The incident destroys Joe's confidence and he sinks into a depression that keeps him away from work. But his life is set to change when the company's 'wellness co-ordinator', Meg Harper, pays him a visit. There's immediate mutual attraction, but something she says to Joe also inadvertently sparks a desire for revenge in him. It's not long before he's training with Chuck Scarett, a former martial arts film star; and - back at work - his new, assertive persona is winning him legions of friends. But not everyone is impressed - Natalie and Meg preferred him as he was..(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

programme.desc: An American family reunion at a remote holiday home turns sour when it is riven by bitter in-fights and seething resentment. However, the petty squabbling ends when one of the guests receives a crossbow bolt in his head. There's masked nutters outside...and they they've got murder on their mind. The home invasion horror staple gets an ultra-violent twist in a slick horror which wittily subverts the genre(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Horror tale in which a group of teenagers who believe they have cheated death find themselves at the mercy of an unknown force that seems intent on killing them off one by one. When one of the group's violent prophecy is fulfilled in the form of a plane crash, he and the others who left the flight are subjected to paranormal horror(n)

programme.title: Final Destination 2
programme.desc: Death is back and he wants more victims in this follow-up to the teen horror hit Final Destination. Ali Carter, the only survivor of the original cull is recruited by A J Cook to stop his second campaign. Cook foresaw a freeway pileup but those she saved by her actions are now marked. Can the pair, aided by cop Michael Landes and the knowledge of the sage Tony Todd save those marked for death?(n)

programme.title: Final Destination 3
programme.desc: (2006) James Wong, who directed the first film in the horror franchise, returned for this sequel. Mary Elizabeth Winstead plays Wendy Christensen, who has a premonition that the roller coaster she and her school friends are on is going to crash. Sure enough, after they get off, there is a spectacular, satisfyingly gory crash. But once again, Death will not be cheated of his due and, as the survivors succumb one by one in suitably ingenious ways (the tanning salon incident is particularly worth catching), Wendy and her friend Kevin Fischer (Ryan Merriman) try to work out who is next and how they'll escape(n)

programme.title: The Final Destination
programme.desc: Part four of the gory horror franchise. Bobby Campo saves the lives of a group of people at a race track, but Death stalks the survivors. Strong language/violence(n)

programme.desc: After being nominated seven times to the Oscars, Martin Scorsese won the Best Director statuette for this crime thriller starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson and Mark Wahlberg, among other stars. Billy Costigan is a police officer assigned to work undercover with Irish mobster Frank Costello to get evidences to arrest him. On the other side, Colin Sullivan, the informer of Costello, is promoted in the Massachusetts State Police. The Departed also received the Best Picture Academy Award(n)

But with adolescence comes a greater understanding of his superhuman powers, leading to his rebirth as a crusader for justice and defender of the American way of life. Comic-strip adventure, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Margot Kidder and Marlon Brando.(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: This year's contest draws to a close as the four finalists - Michelle John, Jamie Miller, Into the Ark and Mo Adeniran - take to the stage in the first part of the two-part climax. Having progressed through seven weeks of blind auditions, two battle rounds, four live knockout stages and the ever-tense quarter- and semi-finals, the would-be stars face the ultimate test of their vocal abilities, with the winner earning themselves a prestigious contract with Polydor Records. Superstar coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Jennifer Hudson and Gavin Rossdale are on hand to share their thoughts as each performer steps down from the stage, with one of them being eliminated from the contest before the last programme of the series.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: A man wrecks a jewellery store and puts a security guard in hospital. Murtaugh delves deep into the psyche of the suspect, a former Navy Seal once treated for post traumatic stress disorder, and draws parallels between him and his partner Riggs, who also once served in the military. Although Riggs' association with the suspect threatens to interfere with the case, it also forces him to open up to his colleague about the experiences that have shaped him. Clayne Crawford, Damon Wayans and Dante Brown star.(n)

programme.desc: Liz Bonnin enjoys one of Britain's National Trails as she walks part of the Thames Path through Oxfordshire - meeting some of the people and animals who call the banks of this impressive river home. Ben Fogle is in Whitby on the North Yorkshire coast to follow one of the nation's favourite dishes - fish and chips - from sea to plate. The programme also catches up with Dales shepherdess Amanda Owen as her family celebrates dad Clive's birthday.(n)

programme.desc: James Bond is sent to steal a top-secret Soviet decoding machine and ends up helping its operator defect to the West. However, he discovers the mission is really a trap set by international crime syndicate Spectre, and struggles to evade his would-be assassins. Spy thriller, starring Sean Connery, Robert Shaw, Daniela Bianchi and Lotte Lenya.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's Alien Fun Capsule
programme.desc: The big-collared comedian returns with another round of madcap fun and laughter, joined by comedians Ross Noble and David O'Doherty, veteran broadcaster Gloria Hunniford and Game of Thrones actor Raleigh Ritchie (Greyworm). Their job is supposedly to help Harry fill a capsule with jokes, games, songs and clips to prove just how funny the human race can be and prevent an alien invasion - but in actual fact it's just an excuse to let Harry bring his particular brand of comedy back to prime-time TV.(n)

programme.title: Five Gold Rings
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Phillip Schofield, in which two friends from Brighton take on a father and son to answer visual questions by placing rings on an LED floor in five increasingly difficult stages. Viewers can play along using the series app.(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part final, as we learn which of the three remaining acts will have been chosen by the voting viewers as this year's winner and be awarded a prestigious contract with Polydor Records. Superstar coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Jennifer Hudson and Gavin Rossdale are on hand as the singers give their final performances. Michelle John, Jamie Miller, Into the Ark and Mo Adeniran made it to the first stage of the final, with one eliminated before the conclusion. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called to the University of Northumberland when Jamie Marshall, a promising young journalism student, falls to his death from the top of a disused faculty building. With no eyewitnesses and no immediate leads, Vera turns to friends and family to glean all she can about Jamie, and to discover who might have wanted him dead. The student's innocent facade is revealed to have concealed simmering resentment and anger which he expressed on the internet - and which may have made him some deadly enemies.(n)

programme.title: The Nightly Show

Co-starring Gemma Jones, Patrick Troughton, James Grout and Peter Woodthorpe.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour

Roger Allam and Charlie Creed-Miles co-star in the mystery.(n)

Before any more crimes are committed, the team must uncover the guilty secret that the victims share in order to learn the identity of the killer and the potential victims.(n)

programme.desc: Margo takes great pride in her new job at the surgery, but after a chance encounter with a recluse, she begins to realise where her greatest talent lies. programme.title: Churchill's Secret
programme.desc: Michael Gambon stars as Winston Churchill in this feature-length drama based on Jonathan Smith's novel. In 1953, a nurse (Romola Garai) is summoned to a secret location where she learns she is needed to treat the elderly prime minister, who has suffered a stroke and is not expected to survive. She bears witness as Churchill's family gather by his bedside preparing for the worst, and sees the long-buried tensions between them rising to the surface. Also starring Lindsay Duncan, Bill Paterson and Tara Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part one of two. When the body of student Josh Tate is found dumped in a ravine, the investigation into his stabbing uncovers a very different man to the quiet character described by his flatmate Spencer. It emerges that Josh was infatuated with Spencer's girlfriend and had been manufacturing Ecstasy for club owner Liam Fallon. Meanwhile, DI Morton's ex-lover Martin Hexton has arrived, claiming to be working on a local case. When Fallon comes under suspicion as Josh's murderer the detectives break into his flat and find him badly beaten - and to complicate matters, it looks as if Hexton is responsible.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part two of two. Morton works hard to win back Banks's approval and discovers Hexton is the biological father of murdered student Josh. The team traces the former undercover police officer to Gerald and Elaine Foster's house, but it's too late - Hexton has kidnapped lap-dancer Melanie. When his victim collapses, however, he takes her to hospital, where ex-lover Helen corners him and has him arrested. What will he reveal about Josh and Melanie, and the attack on club owner Liam? Stephen Tompkinson stars.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Syndicate 9 find themselves dealing with a high-profile historical case after Mandy Sweeting's body is recovered from a quarry, 23 years after she was first reported missing. However, Rachel's biggest challenge might not be dealing with the media attention or even re-interviewing bereft family members, but hiding her contempt for Rob Waddington's father Frankie (former Coronation Street star Ian Mercer), who led the original investigation. Meanwhile, Janet also has problems to deal with at home, as Elise moves in with her dad and his new girlfriend. But at least it inspires the detective to look at her own love life, as she confides in Rachel that she's started using dating sites. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp and Danny Miller.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel promised the chaos of her personal life was all in the past, but she is conflicted upon discovering her mother's new boyfriend is a violent domestic abuser. Meanwhile, Janet gets cold feet when she goes on her first date, terrified at the idea of having to impress a stranger. The crimebusters are united in the search for the killer of Rich Hutchings, who is found murdered in the flat he shares with his husband Adam. Barry, their outspoken and violent homophobic neighbour, is the prime suspect. However, as Adam's friend Tim struggles to recall the events of their night out, it seems Barry may be in the clear. Meanwhile, Rachel is horrified when her mum Sharon turns up asking for help. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp and Danny Miller.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: In 1838, at the age of 18, young princess Alexandrina's life is transformed when she ascends the throne of Great Britain and becomes Queen Victoria. As monarch in her own right, the young Victoria suddenly finds herself freed of the repressive shackles placed on her by her mother's advisor, Conroy, and builds a new alliance with the charismatic prime minister Lord Melbourne. However, her inexperience makes her susceptible to mistakes - and ultimately scandal. Period drama, starring Jenna Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Summer Catch
programme.desc: This summer could not be more crucial for Ryan Dunne, a blue-collar kid with aspirations to become a major league baseball player. Every summer, the hottest college ball players descend upon Cape Cod to pursue their baseball dreams during the day and blow off steam in town at night. The first local boy in years to earn a slot in the team, Ryan finally got his shot but the temptations off-field are getting in the way of his commitment to the game. Soon, a beautiful young woman who summers in the town with her family distracts Ryan. As the friction builds between his loyal townie friends and his cocky teammates, Ryan's rivalry with hotshot teammate Eric comes to a head. When a major league scout comes along, however, he tries to push the pangs of romance and player rivalry aside, because his sports talent may be his only ticket out of the small industrial town(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Ray Dodd hosts the first dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but finds his guests a difficult crowd to please. Recruitment executive Michelle Watson turns her nose up at the salmon starter, while choir director Joseph Benneh sends his steak back to the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment executive Michelle Watson welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but the previous night's host Ray Dodd is hungry for revenge following stinging criticism of his efforts. Michelle's cooking also fails to impress Joseph Benneh, so her hopes of scooping the week's prize rest with her choice of entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stuart Henson hosts a safari-themed dinner party on the third night in Milton Keynes. He hopes his exotic menu of zebra steak and `elephant dung surprise' will please his guests, but after the insults of the previous night he faces a difficult challenge to persuade his fellow diners to get along.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Choir director Joseph Benneh hosts the fourth dinner party in Milton Keynes, hoping the flavours from his homeland Ghana and a vocal masterclass will prove a winning combination. The guests' expectations are high, so he is under pressure to hit the spot with a menu that includes chicken liver pate, and groundnut soup with coconut rice.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Country enthusiast Susan Rogers hosts the final dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, hoping her French cuisine will win her extra points. She also demonstrates her skills with an accordion and gives her guests an origami masterclass, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Hampshire, Wiltshire and Surrey as they try to find homes for this week's couples. Retirees Sheila and Jason are living out of boxes after selling their home in Morecambe and now they just want to be nearer their families, while Sue and Alan have moved back from Australia, only to find their generous budget of £450,000 does not stretch to the spacious apartment they had Down Under - and getting them to downsize could prove an uphill struggle for Phil.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: A former businesswoman seeks a home in north Wales but is unsure if she wants to live by the coast or in the countryside, so Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help solve her dilemma.(n)

programme.title: Rivers with Jeremy Paxman
programme.desc: The presenter travels along the Thames from its source in Gloucestershire to the Kent and Essex marshes, and delves into its history as a working river going back to the time of the Domesday Book. He meets people who maintain the river's locks and bridges, and work to manage flooding and deal with sewage. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Knockaloe Beg Farm on the Isle of Man, where owners Fiona and John Anderson hope their guests will embrace their green ethos. They kick things off with an afternoon of laser mayhem, and continue the fun the next day by following breakfast with hands-on animal antics.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests head to The Arches on the Isle of Man for their second stay, where owner Phil Routledge hopes to wow them with scenic views and scuba diving at the B&B's own pool. However, some of the owners are dismayed by modern gadgets with a lack of instructions, and even find cobwebs in their rooms.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants arrive at the Trafford in Blackpool, owned by Robbie and John Welling, who are proud of their traditional `bucket and spade' B&B. The guests are pleasantly surprised, even if previous host Phil is intent on finding dust as a bit of tit-for-tat retaliation, and the afternoon is spent learning the art of making sticks of rock.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Host Julie welcomes the contestants to Sheepy Lodge, Warwickshire, where they are shocked by their surroundings, and disappointed by a variety of things in the rooms. The host puts on some old-fashioned parlour games, before a fierce hide-and-seek contest erupts. At breakfast, Julie frets when she must prepare poached eggs, and is left emotional after the feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rival B&B owners meet to settle some scores and discover what they have been paid. Knockaloe Beg Farm owners Fiona and John Anderson tackle criticisms of a missing host at breakfast, and Phil Routledge from The Arches on the Isle of Man takes on Robbie and John Welling from The Trafford in Blackpool about their `forensic investigation'. After some heated discussion, the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marketing manager Andrea Nichols hosts the first night in a week of dinner parties that span Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. She welcomes dance instructor Nicola O'Donnell, saleswoman Penny Peklivanas, music producer Tim Lawson and events entertainer Andy Harvey into her garden that has been decked out with straw and stuffed chickens in a bid to win the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kitchenware saleswoman Penny Peklivanas hosts the second party in a competition that spans Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. She is confident her grand house will impress her rivals and win her the £1,000 cash prize, but her croissant-based main course is not to everyone's taste.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT analyst and music producer Tim Lawson hosts the third dinner party of the week in the competition taking place across Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire, hoping to impress his diners with ingredients brought back from Morocco. He also offers an urban music education in a bid to claim the £1,000-prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance instructor Nicola O'Donnell hosts the fourth dinner party of the competition spanning Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. The guests expect very little from the night, but Nicola hopes to impress Jamaican-born contestant Tim Lawson with her Caribbean-inspired evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Andy Harvey hosts the final night of the competition which has visited Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. He decides to pull out all the stops at his Stevenage home, hoping to impress with extravagant food and outrageous entertainment - including a luminous underwater disco. At the end of the evening, his dinner guests reveal their scores before the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: A visit to a town in South Carolina where it's raining popcorn-like snow - actually little balls of ice called graupel that appear harmless but could trigger avalanches. Storm chaser Geoff Mackley films a dangerous concoction of volcanic ash, rocks, debris and water called lahar, and a man in Newfoundland records footage of a strange, rolling bank of fog that looks like a tsunami. In Canberra, there's a giant tornado born not from a thundercloud but from a colossal firestorm, while in the Peak District, strong winds defy gravity - blowing a waterfall upwards.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Wildest Weather
programme.desc: Footage of unusual weather conditions recorded in Britain during 2016, and exploring the factors that led to these incidents. The programme features footage recorded by people caught in the middle of floods, super-storms, tornadoes and lightning strikes, as well as a look at how a record level El Nino effect altered Britain's weather.(n)

programme.title: Lee Mack: Hit the Road Mack
programme.desc: Filmed at London's Hammersmith Apollo, this documentary showcases the multi award-winning star at the top of his game, in a performance that soon has his audience roaring with laughter. Lee's trademark humour of well-created gags and sharp one-liners are plentiful as he muses on the perils of everyday life, while sharing plenty of fun, quips and banter with the audience.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Vic Reeves and Aisling Bea join host Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson for more comic innuendos, unpredictable conundrums and unforgivable puns in the comedy quiz. David O'Doherty is with Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr, Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by Bob Mortimer and Holly Walsh for more comic innuendos and unpredictable conundrums. Claudia Winkleman stands in for Rachel Riley on letters-and-numbers duty, while Isy Suttie is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Wildest Weather
programme.desc: Footage of unusual weather conditions recorded in Britain during 2016, and exploring the factors that led to these incidents. The programme features footage recorded by people caught in the middle of floods, super-storms, tornadoes and lightning strikes, as well as a look at how a record level El Nino effect altered Britain's weather.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: The first of a two-part compilation of highlights from the current series of the irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr. Teams captained by Jon Richardson and Sean Lock answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller heads to the Isle of Wight to help with a risky procedure on a Bengal tiger, and he also performs surgery on a donkey with a sinus problem.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Phil Spencer takes his cocker spaniels out in Windsor Great Park, Clive Anderson is on the Isle of Mull with his terrier and Katy Brand is in Constable country with her dog.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Med
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton visits the Spanish island of Mallorca, where he discovers an Arab bath house that is over 1,000 years old in Palma's old town.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barber Kenny Flynn hosts the first dinner party in Liverpool. His evening has a `big kids' theme, so he prepares burger buns striped like a zebra and baby octopuses that resemble spiders. His guests are Nigerian model Cynthia Umezulike, rock music enthusiast Glen Simpson, businessman Rob Spicer and fine-dining enthusiast Jilly Pollock.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Multiple business owner Rob Spicer welcomes the diners to his home for the second party in Liverpool. He is convinced his `historical leader' theme will be a hit, but there is a shock in store as one of the guests reveals a secret about herself.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Model and barrister Cynthia Umezulike hosts the third dinner party in Liverpool, and hopes her meal including tribal fish, a traditional Nigerian jeloff and an exotic fruit platter will impress her guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rock music enthusiast Glen Simpson hosts the fourth dinner party in Liverpool. He rustles up sticky blackened pork and an Elvis-inspired dessert of deep fat-fried chocolate bars with home-made peanut butter and banana ice-cream, but grievances among the guests threaten to derail the evening's entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jilly Pollock hosts the fifth and final party in Liverpool, inviting her fellow contestants to a black-tie event. She prepares a selection of self-styled dishes for her diners, including figs, hot beef and berry delight, and hopes an evening of ballroom dancing will ease tensions following the previous night's arguments.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Dunsandles Guest House in New Brighton, Merseyside, where owner Alan Johnson and his professional sidekick Dave Owen hope to win the title - but a scandal with some unwanted hair on the bed sheets is not a good start, and two guests feel they are making an exhibition of themselves with a tea-trolley in full view of the neighbours.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the second day of the competition, the contestants visit the Lady Teal Hotel Boat on the waterways near Burnley in Lancashire, and owners Nick and Gina Mead hope to impress them with an afternoon of entertainment out on the locks. At breakfast, one of the guests admits to not enjoying his stay.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From York House in Tetbury, Gloucestershire, where Brock Bergius hopes that his cheeky sense of humour and perfectionist nature will help him win the competition. He is in his element making saucy jokes during an afternoon of sausage making, but his reluctance to stray from the menu at breakfast leaves some of his guests disappointed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Heyford House in Oxfordshire, where Leo and Sonya Brooke-Little hope to impress the contestants with their hospitality. The afternoon event is boxing, which Brock Burgius sees as the perfect opportunity to settle some scores with his fellow competitors.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's winner is announced as the B&B owners meet for the last time to thrash out their differences. Feedback includes criticism of a badly positioned tea tray, controversy over a hot chocolate and accusations of overenthusiastic hosting.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog-lover Kerry Bolwell-Williams kicks off a week of dinner parties in the Welsh valleys, where she hopes that a full choir and a simple menu will impress her guests and make her an early contender for the £1,000 prize. However, she does not react well when it is suggested that her home has a rather distinctive smell.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Food-lover and theme park fan Dave Morris hosts the second dinner party in the Welsh valleys, hoping his home-grown herbs, hand-picked fruit and complicated menu will win him the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Shop owner Tasnim Sardar hosts the third night of the competition in the Welsh valleys, and hopes her Pakistani-inspired party will secure her the £1,000 prize. Financial advisor Gill Leonard likes her curries to be hot and spicy, and is particularly pleased by Tasnim's curried cauliflower.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ryan Woodward hosts on the fourth night in the Welsh valleys and has put a lot of thought into his evening, but each of his courses goes wrong - from a bread blunder to a clam crisis. He hopes an Ibizan dance lesson and drinks served in his hot tub will help to turn the party around.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in the Welsh valleys, financial advisor Gill Leonard dons the oven gloves to entertain the other contestants, and there is a dramatic start to the evening thanks to a mock fire-breathing dragon. Later, the host makes a remarkable revelation to her shocked guests.(n)

programme.title: How to Lose Weight Well
programme.desc: Dr Xand van Tulleken and dietician Hala El-Shafie are on hand as dieters attempt the most hyped and written about diets on the market today. In this offering, Emilie and Harriet have two weeks to slim down for a photo shoot, while cousins Natasha and Chiquita go on a six week diet for Natasha's wedding. And brothers Gary and Wayne want to slim down for a darts competition due in four months. Xand also investigates how exposure to extreme temperatures can affect weight loss.(n)

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: Roman general Maximus Decimus Meridius is a casualty of a power struggle between the corrupt Emperor Commodus and the senate. Ordered to be put to death along with his family, he escapes his would-be killers but is sold into slavery as a gladiator - but uses his fame in the arena to fight against the tyrant. Oscar-winning period epic, with Russell Crowe, Joaquin Phoenix, Derek Jacobi and Oliver Reed, in his last film role.(n)

programme.title: Club Disney
programme.sub-title: Wander Over Yonder/Darkwing Duck/101 Dalmatians/Classic Cartoons.
programme.desc: Crazy cartoons and animated adventures for younger viewers.(n)

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Spin-off show following the adventures of Wallace and Gromit's lovable friend.(n)

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: Horrible Histories: Awesome Alfred the Great Special.
programme.desc: A look at the life of the English king, who defeats the Viking by using cunning tactics and summoning the spirit of Ed Sheeran. Starring Tom Rosenthal.(n)

programme.title: Bernard Dunne's Mythical Heroes
programme.desc: Oisin, son of Fionn MacCumhaill, is now an old man as he recounts his life and talks about the Ireland he knew before he left for Tir na nOg.(n)

programme.title: Junior MasterChef
programme.desc: Young aspiring chefs create their ultimate pasta dish from a selection of mystery ingredients, and are then given one-hour to make two of their favourite dishes in a bid to impress judges John Torode and Donal Skehan.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Triple bill. The latest comings and goings in sun-kissed Summer Bay.(n)

programme.title: Champions League Magazine
programme.desc: Focusing on European football's elite club competition, featuring highlights, news and previews of forthcoming matches, as well as a look through the archives at classic battles featuring some of the game's greatest players.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.desc: A 10-year-old lhasa apso is discovered with matted fur and poor skin. When Herchy Boal gets him to the vet, they also discover a possible heart condition. Mel Fisher checks on Tiger, a two-year-old rottweiler, who is underweight and in poor condition. And after rescuing 65 dogs from dire surroundings in a Manchester kennels, Vicki Macdonald finds out what happened to some of those she saved.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Short Circuit
programme.desc: A military robot is struck by lightning and develops a mind of its own. The machine embarks on a series of comic misadventures, but the company that made him want him back. He realises his only hope is to convince the scientist who invented him that he really is alive. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Steve Guttenberg, Ally Sheedy and Fisher Stevens.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Empire of the Desert Ants.
programme.desc: Documentary filmed in Arizona, following a honey ant queen's rise to dominance and the methods it uses to extend its influence and keep its subjects under control, including cannibalism, genocide, the ruthless elimination of rivals and the sacrifice of thousands. Narrated by Andy Serkis.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham concludes his study of peculiar natural events with the help of eyewitness footage, first-hand accounts and scientific explanations. Featuring the story of a virgin snake that gave birth in the UK, a sea serpent that washed up on the Californian coast and 12 goats that were found standing perfectly still in a tree in Morocco.(n)

programme.title: Talk to the Animals
programme.desc: Lucy Cooke concludes her global exploration of the world of animal communication, focusing on how they talk to friends and enemies and even what they say to their neighbours. The zoologist discovers the many uses of the spotted hyena's call, tricks some vervet monkeys into warning each other of danger, meets the only bat in the world that can eavesdrop on frogs and finds out that dolphins not only greet one another, they also have unique signatures or names.(n)

programme.title: After Earth
programme.desc: A spaceship crash leaves a renowned war hero and his 13-year-old son stranded on Earth, which was abandoned by the human race centuries ago. Since mankind's departure, the planet has become home to all manner of dangerous life-forms, and the boy must make a desperate journey across hostile terrain to secure a rescue for his injured father. Sci-fi adventure, starring Will and Jaden Smith, with Sophie Okonedo.(n)

programme.title: Homeland
programme.desc: Dar plays his hand and Quinn revisits his past. Thriller following a team of CIA agents battling terrorists and problems in their personal lives. Claire Danes stars.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy 3: Back in Training
programme.desc: Facing closure from cutbacks in public spending and competition from a more successful academy, the police training school calls on its bungling graduates to act as instructors and make good officers out of a bunch of new recruits even more incompetent than they are. Comedy sequel, starring Steve Guttenberg, Bubba Smith, Michael Winslow and Art Metrano.(n)

programme.title: The Catch
programme.desc: Alice and the team take on a very public client, a husband who was wrongly imprisoned for murdering his wife. However, she is distracted with a mission of her own - to track down Ben and figure out his next move. Meanwhile, Ben, Margot and Reggie are in desperate need of cash since Alice foiled their last plan, and the three con-artists set their sights on a new target.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: Mr Gunn discovers one of the pupils could be his son, so he sets about making the boy's school days as enjoyable as possible - while Mr Church and Mr Martin battle to spread the gossip as far and wide as possible. As parents' evening arrives, the sports teacher views the event in a completely different light - while everyone else enjoys viewing Miss Postern's considerable cleavage. But the big question is - can they all get home in time for the final of The Great British Bake Off? David Walliams, Catherine Tate and Philip Glenister star in the classroom comedy.(n)

programme.title: Containment
programme.sub-title: I to Die, You to Live.
programme.desc: Lex learns that a woman who had close contact with an infected patient is missing, Jake spirals out of control, Katie keeps an eye on her students, and Teresa makes a discovery.(n)

programme.desc: European and international headlines live via satellite.(n)

programme.title: Kate & Mim-Mim
programme.desc: Gobble worries that he has lost his touch as a gardener.(n)

programme.title: Wild Kratts
programme.desc: Animation for children about two brothers who use creature power suits created from animal DNA.(n)

programme.title: Zig and Zag

programme.title: Pinky and the Brain
programme.desc: The adventures of two genetically engineered lab mice who are trying to take over the world.(n)

programme.title: Sabrina the Teenage Witch
programme.desc: Supernatural comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart as the all-American girl with amazing powers.(n)

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep

programme.title: Little Lunch

programme.title: Music Inc

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall travels to Guadalupe off the coast of Mexico, and swims outside of the cage with the most feared shark on the planet - the great white.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Double bill. The latest comings and goings in sun-kissed Summer Bay.(n)

programme.title: Secret Eaters
programme.desc: A married couple agree to have their eating habits scrutinised 24 hours a day by Anna Richardson to find out more about their weight gain. Helena, 55, is convinced her size is all down to the menopause, while husband Murray is at a loss to explain why he's clocking in at 18 stone. There's also a look at a roadside cafe popular with truckers, and Jane Ogden from the University of Surrey conducts an experiment to find out whether the positioning of fruit and vegetables in a school canteen encourages children to choose healthier food options.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam breaks his arm and tells his school friends he fell off a hoverboard like the hero in Back to the Future, but the lie threatens his friendship with Emmy Mirsky. Meanwhile, Beverly fears she's being replaced in the kitchen when the family falls in love with the new Chinese restaurant in town. An 11-year old boy captures his family on his video camera as they grow up in the 1980s. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.sub-title: The Most Handsome Boy on the Planet.
programme.desc: Barry is excited when a modelling agency representative approaches him, but Erica thinks it's a scam. Meanwhile, Adam tries to get Murray to build bridges with his father.(n)

programme.title: Forever Young
programme.desc: A 1930s test pilot is devastated when his sweetheart is left in a coma. Unable to cope with waiting to see if she wakes up, he volunteers to be a subject for a cryonics experiment. However, he ends up being on ice for 50 years, until two boys discover him. The youngsters' mother helps him adjust to the strange new world he has found himself in - and romance soon blossoms. Romantic sci-fi drama, with Mel Gibson, Jamie Lee Curtis, Elijah Wood and George Wendt.(n)

programme.title: Once Upon a Time
programme.desc: Emma and Regina try to find a way out of the enchanted forest, while Hook and David search for Gideon.(n)

programme.title: Living the Wildlife
programme.desc: Cameraman Colin Stafford-Johnson visits the Skellig Islands off Co Kerry's coast, where he views puffins as their chicks hatch in the island's honeycomb of underground burrows. The presenter also manages to capture rare footage of a pair of shearwaters, as they make an unusual move and nest in the same area as the puffins.(n)

programme.title: Coast Australia
programme.desc: The team heads to the island of Tasmania, where Neil Oliver investigates the penal history of Port Arthur during the colonial era and visits the southern hemisphere's largest wooden boat festival. Brendan Moar examines life in the grip of a lighthouse on a remote island, while Emma Johnston finds out how science and industry are saving the marine neighbourhood. Tim Flannery investigates state capital Hobart's long and illustrious role in Antarctic exploration and Xanthe Mallett delves into the history of whaling.(n)

programme.title: Wild Patagonia
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the wild and varied landscapes of Patagonia, which remain largely untouched by modern civilisation, and are home to some of nature's most adaptable creatures.(n)

programme.title: World's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham presents more amazing facts and fun, discovering the secrets behind mysterious holes in the Russian tundra, finding an underwater lake and meeting the creator of a cannon built especially for salmon. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Maitre d' Mateo Saina welcomes more potential couples, including accountant Ross and part-time waitress Sorcha, and Dublin film-maker Katie and nurse Brianna.(n)

programme.title: Road Cops
programme.desc: Police are called to a brawl in the street.. Reality series following New Zealand's cops as they catch careless drivers.(n)

programme.title: Road Cops
programme.desc: Police confront knife-carrying youths, and a pizza delivery driver tries to outrun officers. Reality series following New Zealand's cops as they catch careless drivers.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Bedfordshire target motorists breaking the law, including those using mobile phones, not wearing seatbelts, or having illegal number plates. The reason for this enforcement is brought sharply into focus when police are called to a three-car pile-up, caused by a driver using a phone behind the wheel, in which a girl is seriously injured. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Bedfordshire are trained in the use of an electroshock weapon, and the experience is put into practice when they use the device to disarm a gang member in the middle of the night and take him into custody. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Aled Jones helps a couple from Enfield, north London, find a detached property in Essex on a budget of £400,000. Their wish list is long, including rural views, a big kitchen, and a garden with enough space to create a veggie plot.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple from Maidenhead, with a £500,000 budget, who want to relocate from Berkshire to Somerset and find a three-bedroom detached house with at least two acres of land for growing vegetables and keep animals.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a five-bedroom property in Plymouth, a Victorian cottage in Croydon, south London, and a former coach house in Cardiff. They then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, and how much they paid for them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a cafe with a first-floor flat in Pembrokeshire, a three bedroom mid-terraced house in London and a two bedroom mid-terrace in Stoke-on-Trent, then follow the sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton travels to Derbyshire to find an idyllic retreat for a couple from Herefordshire with a budget of £375,000. However, the pair struggle to agree on whether they want rural isolation or a property in a village.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Spalding.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles is in Spalding, Lincolnshire, to meet Dakota Read and her family. The eight-year-old was born with quadriplegic cerebral palsy and her home needs to be made more wheelchair-friendly. Enter the DIY SOS builders, who set to work on designer Gabrielle Blackman's vision, although with just nine days to complete the task, they'll need help. Luckily, the local tradespeople are also out in force, giving their time and their skills for free.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Sunderland.
programme.desc: Ever since suffering a brain infection four years ago, Sunderland woman June Findlay has been unable to walk or talk and is totally dependent on her devoted husband John. Since then she has been sleeping on a hospital bed in the kitchen, with no washing or toilet facilities. Joan and John do their best, but Nick Knowles believes they deserve better, so he and his small band of builders - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - set out to extend the Findlays' home, with designer Oliver Heath on hand to protect his vision. Can they give June back her dignity?.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Aled Jones helps a couple from Enfield, north London, find a detached property in Essex on a budget of £400,000. Their wish list is long, including rural views, a big kitchen, and a garden with enough space to create a veggie plot.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple from Maidenhead, with a £500,000 budget, who want to relocate from Berkshire to Somerset and find a three-bedroom detached house with at least two acres of land for growing vegetables and keep animals.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse tries to find a couple their first home together in Wiltshire, but they are hoping to locate a party pad with a big kitchen, plenty of bedrooms for friends to stay, and land for a horse.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Law & Disorder
programme.sub-title: Louis Theroux: Law & Disorder in Lagos.
programme.desc: The journalist meets gangs known as Area Boys as they patrol their neighbourhoods in the Nigerian city of Lagos, clashing with rivals in a bid to keep the peace on the streets. He is taken under the wing of their leader MC, a street youth who is now friends with the most powerful men in the city, and also spends time with the government's paramilitary tasks force, whose ruthless tactics are not that different to those of the gangs.(n)

programme.title: Married Behind Bars
programme.desc: Every bride dreams of the perfect wedding day, but what happens when the groom is in prison? In 2014, in California alone, more than 1,800 weddings took place behind bars, and this documentary follows the stories of three American women who have decided to tie the knot while their partners are serving time. Negotiating a myriad regulations and restrictions, the couples must follow strict dress codes, walk down the aisle via an X-ray machine and kiss each other through bulletproof glass.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The Humberside Police force's traffic cops have their hands full during the half-term holidays, chasing youths as young as 13 as they attempt to steal, crash and burn cars. Jamie Theakston narrates.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Between 1975 and 1980, serial killer Peter Sutcliffe - known in the press as the Yorkshire Ripper - murdered 13 women and attacked at least seven more in the north of England. In this programme, psychologists and criminology experts analyse the personality of Sutcliffe and look at events in his childhood and adult life that may have triggered his descent into murder, and also examine how he managed to avoid suspicion despite being interviewed by police numerous times.(n)

programme.title: Medical Emergency
programme.desc: A small boy is treated after being bitten by a venomous spider, and a man is rushed to hospital by air ambulance.(n)

programme.title: Medical Emergency
programme.desc: A patient waits months for a donor heart, and a cyclist sustains neck injuries.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping

programme.title: Animal SOS
programme.desc: The RSPCA and the police team up to crack down on the illegal puppy trade. Meanwhile, a pair of pigs cause trouble in a back garden and a cat suffers an injury caused by its own collar. Narrated by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: Animal SOS
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of RSPCA officers across the country as they try to rescue pets and wildlife from harm, and give them better lives.(n)

programme.title: Passport Patrol
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary about the lives of customs and immigration officers at New Zealand's biggest airports.(n)

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes
programme.desc: Cameras follow the work of the Yorkshire Air Ambulance service, as one of its members performs surgery in the street to save the passenger of a stolen car. Presented by Rav Wilding.(n)
